review_content: Znakomity, niezwykle czysty i orzeźwiający lager, lekka goryczka na finiszu, wybitnie pijalne i bardzo "piwne" piwo.
Wenig überzeugendes helles. Überraschend „viel“ Bitterkeit und recht starker Malz. Es fehlt die Leichtigkeit eines Hellen. Sehr pappig auf der Zunge.

33 ml. bottle. Clear, golden-colored with a white frothy head. Aroma is malt, biscuit, and maybe some lemon. Taste is balanced with some bitterness. Finish is moderately bitter and dry. Medium body, oily texture. A nice lager.
Leciutkie masło w aromacie, ale w smaku czuć niemiecki charakter. Może bez wysokiej goryczki, ale chmiel wyczuwalny jest też charakterystyczna szorstkość i czysty profil.

500 ML can. Lighter golden color with head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is rather light. A lighter beer than expected without much body. Dry and slight happy bitterness on the back end. A good beer for warm summer days.
Clear yellow colored beer eith a good white standing head. Taste is malty, herbal tastes from het hops.
Bottle at home, golden beer, small head. Aroma is malt, yeast, sweet, taste is the same, sweet, malt, dough, bitter, sweet, ok
Burk från systembolaget. Gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Maltig och vattnig med toner av citrus och gräs. Torr avslutning.

Can bought @Studenac in Loviste. Super pale watery yellow with lots of visible carbonation, unstable rocky head. Sweet malts, freshly cut grass. More body than the thin look suggests. Taste follows aroma. Quite a pleasant, refreshing experience.

Botella 0,33l de Hopt. Color dorada clara, transparente, espuma blanca, fina, resistente. Aroma malta intenso, pan, herbal. Sabor dulzor suave con notas amargas, muy bien equilibrado, malta intenso, cereales, pan, herbal. Esta maravilla hay que repetir mas y mas. Clásica.

Clear gold with very little visual carbonation in the form of tiny bubbles.  Light grain aroma.  Quick diminishing head.  Crisp clean taste with the perfect hop balance to match style.  Crisp dry finish.
Burk systembolaget. Halmgul vätska. Doft och smak av hö, örter och bröd. Lätt och frisk

Paulaner Original Münchner Hell_05.2022

Biała dość obfita piana, szybko znika. Barwa słomkowa, ładnie klarowne. W zapachu nuty słodowe, zbożowe. W smaku orzeźwiające, słodowe. Goryczka jest, nawet spoko. Schodzi szybko, bardzo pijalne, idealne na letni upalny dzień.
dobry lager, nie wiem co więcej napisać, to się spodziewałem to dostałem. lekki,  gasi pragnienie fajnie goryczkowego

0,5l bottle from local store, drinking it on 07/06/2021 BB 04/22. Also had in can. Pours crystal clear pale golden with nice good lasting white foam on top, some lacing. Aroma of malt, hay, cereal, biscuit.. taste is sweet and clean with similar taste, a bit lemony and biscuit notes first then some gentle moderate grassy hops in the finish, pretty clean and crisp. A bit mineral-water like and fresh, fizzy higher carbonation. Kinda light body. Easy, sweet and a bit simple but it fits the style and it works. Really easy and drinkable, refreshing. Of the famous Munich breweries, there are some helles that i prefer but the Paulaner one is quite a good one.
Znakomity, niezwykle czysty i orzeźwiający lager, lekka goryczka na finiszu, wybitnie pijalne i bardzo "piwne" piwo.
Wenig überzeugendes helles. Überraschend „viel“ Bitterkeit und recht starker Malz. Es fehlt die Leichtigkeit eines Hellen. Sehr pappig auf der Zunge.

Leciutkie masło w aromacie, ale w smaku czuć niemiecki charakter. Może bez wysokiej goryczki, ale chmiel wyczuwalny jest też charakterystyczna szorstkość i czysty profil.

500 ML can. Lighter golden color with head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is rather light. A lighter beer than expected without much body. Dry and slight happy bitterness on the back end. A good beer for warm summer days.
Clear yellow colored beer eith a good white standing head. Taste is malty, herbal tastes from het hops.
Bottle at home, golden beer, small head. Aroma is malt, yeast, sweet, taste is the same, sweet, malt, dough, bitter, sweet, ok
Burk från systembolaget. Gyllengul öl med vitt skum. Maltig och vattnig med toner av citrus och gräs. Torr avslutning.

Botella 0,33l de Hopt. Color dorada clara, transparente, espuma blanca, fina, resistente. Aroma malta intenso, pan, herbal. Sabor dulzor suave con notas amargas, muy bien equilibrado, malta intenso, cereales, pan, herbal. Esta maravilla hay que repetir mas y…

Clear gold with very little visual carbonation in the form of tiny bubbles.  Light grain aroma.  Quick diminishing head.  Crisp clean taste with the perfect hop balance to match style.  Crisp dry finish.
Burk systembolaget. Halmgul vätska. Doft och smak av hö, örter och bröd. Lätt och frisk
Paulaner Original Münchner Hell_05.2022 Biała dość obfita piana, szybko znika. Barwa słomkowa, ładnie klarowne. W zapachu…
dobry lager, nie wiem co więcej napisać, to się spodziewałem to dostałem. lekki,  gasi pragnienie fajnie goryczkowego

0,5l bottle from local store, drinking it on 07/06/2021 BB 04/22. Also had in can. Pours crystal clear pale golden with nice good lasting white foam on top, some lacing. Aroma of malt, hay, cereal, biscuit.. taste is sweet and clean with similar taste, a bit lemony…

500ml bottle. Pours clear light golden with a white head. Aroma of hay, lemon, biscuit. Taste is more of the same. Lacks the body that usually elevates a helles above a standard lager. Decent, but I expected more.

Piwo barwy słomkowej, klarowne. Piana biała, dosyć wysoka zbudowana z drobnych i średnich oczek. Redukuje się  szybko do centymetrowej warstwy, pozostawiając szczątkowy lacing. 
Aromat niezbyt intensywny, siarkowy, słodowy(w typie bułka pszenna), , w tle trochę trawiastych akcentów.
W smaku lekkie, wytrawne, rześkie.  Dominuje delikatna słodowość, na drugim planie pojawia się nieco niewyraźnych ziołowych nut chmielu i odrobina mineralności. 
Wysycenie wysokie,  Goryczka niska w kierunku średniej. Wysoka pijalność. 
Piwo dobrze prezentujące styl Dortmunder akcentując jego wszystkie cechy.

Crystal clear golden color.  Subtle hop flavor, very light body with dry but light hop finish.  Highly carbonated, refreshing like a light pilsner but a little hoppy for me.
6/19/21 update: accidentally bought this thinking it was their dunkel, but it was like a totally different beer than before.  Very balanced tasting with nice maltiness and very subdued hop presence.  Would definitely buy again.

It's what Americans call a German Lager - as far as that goes, this one is pretty good. Clean, crisp, refreshing. A little biscuit malt, a little hops. A touch of citrus and spice. No funk. Dry finish. Classic.

Złote i klarowne, piana drobna, dość trwała, zostawia delikatnie ale trwałe slady na szkle. Aromat czysty slodowy z delikatną nuta trawiastą chmielu. W samku delikatnie zarysoawna nuta słodowa, umieralności i przyjemna, wyraźna trawiasta goryczka. Nasycenie wysokie. Ogólnie można powiedzieć krótko, Niemcy się znają...

Słomkowy, klarowny. Aromat niezbyt intensywny, przyjemny, słodowy (jasne pieczywo).W smaku wytrawne, dominuje "miękka" jasna słodowość, ale na finiszu (dość krótkim, wytrawnym) pojawia się nieco ziołowych nut chmielu i odrobina minerlalności. Goryczka niska, może średnio-niska. Pijalne, rześkie - takie jakie powinno być.

Pour from a 500ml can. Medium gold brew with fizzy head that quickly dissipates. Aroma of citrus and floral hops. Taste is light grain up front, some lemon, finishes with a little grass and yeast in addition. Thin palate. Enjoyable.

500ml can. Clear gold, roaring carbonation, big white head. Aroma is sweet malts, grass and grain but a lightness to it. Sweet smooth malts, grassy, minor citrus zest tang with moderate bitter finish. Soft carbonation on the palate. OK.
Butelka. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

Warka 03.22

Ciężkie słodowe, niewysoka goryczka, coraz gorsze w miarę picia dzięki wychodzącym warzywom, od biedy można ale po co...
Aromat no słodowy buleczkowy slodki podszyty może siareczka. W smaku to samo przyjemny slod i nawet goryczka jest. Orzeźwiające. Po ogrzaniu lekkie nuty utlenienia a niby świeże.

Klarowne, stare złoto. Piana perfekcyjna w ilości średniej. Aromat kwaskowo słodowy. 
Smak czysty, słodowy. Odrobinę mineralny. Przyjemna zbożowość wzbogacona nieśmiałą goryczką. 
Klasyczne jasne z Bawarii. Alles gut
Wypite, krótka ocena bez szczegółowych wrażeń. Normalnie też można pić piwo bez zastanawiania ;)
Light hell. High on sweetness low on hops like a typical hell. On the watery side. Bloating with little freshness. Ok but not a great Bavarian Hell. Some light floral notes giving it some complexity.
Old rating from 2010 - 500ml bottle, pours golden with a big white head. Aromas & tastes of buttery biscuit malt, wood, grass, apple & grain. Moderate body. Clean finish

Crisp cereal aroma with some lemon. Taste is crisp and dry. Nicely hopped with a good astringency reminiscent of gooseberry. Not massively malty but it's there at the end along with a lingering bitterness. Very smooth and easy to drink. Far superior to your average cooking lager. I imagine this would go down a treat sat in a beer garden on a hot day.

Clear and crisp looking fizzy golden ale, with a big fluffy white head, and a lemon and light malt aroma. Initially the taste is sweet malt, with some fruity, floral notes, then mellow bitterness cuts in and carries on into the dry finish. Very refreshing,  and light and drinkable, without offering a great many flavours

Złotej barwy, klarowne. 
Piana ładna po nalaniu, redukuje się do zera.
W smaku i aromacie nuty słodowe, jest lekkie, goryczka bardzo niska.

0.5l can from Auchan. Clean pale yellow body, white head, fairly persistent, pillowy, a bit creamy. Foam has a moderate but persistent bitter taste. Mild (i.e. neutral) malty aroma with a hint of herbs. Sweet, somewhat grainy taste. Moderate but persistent bitter aftertaste, dry, a bit medicine-like. Some herbs and a bit of sourness make it fresh. Moderate carbonation, creamy palate, although a bit crisp. Altogether a harmonic, elegant composition on the moderate sweet side. Very good example of an otherwise somewhat simple type. (My BJCP points: 9/12, 3/3, 16/20, 4/5, 8/10 = 40/50)

500 ml can pours a clear golden color with fluffy white head.  Aroma has bread dough, light grains, and a touch of lemon.  Taste is slightly sweet with a dry finish.  Body is light without much carbonation.  Easy to drink and has the flavors I expected from the style.  Good, but not exciting.
500ml can. Clear golden yellow with a thin foamy white head. Flavors are bread, sweet cereals, honey and lemon with herbal notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation smooth texture.
Excellente pilz, belle couleur, un goût très rafraîchissant (on dirait du maïs ) !
Can from Systembolaget. Clear golden with a medium white head. Sweetish with dough, light grain, bread and malt. A bit dull to be honest.
Bright gold color with a nice white head. Malty aroma. Grainy taste. Slight bitter.

0,5 can from local store. Pours pale golden color with short but stable head. Dry smell. Dry, pleasant taste. Fine carbonation. Decent, balanced taste. Nice beer, drinkable. Bit sweety but not too much. I like it.

Vrlo lepo pivo, izbalansiran ukus, nemam zamerki.
Pite jakiś czas temu. Ocena w celu uzupełnienia profilu. https://www.instagram.com/czgr_

Poured from 330ml bottle into pint glass. A thin white head falls quickly with mild lacing. Color is light gold with moderate carbonation. Aroma of grain husks, grassy hops. Mouthfeel is light with a dry finish. Flavor is mild combination of lightly toasted barley, cracker, a hint of lemon, grassy hops. Overall: excellent.

Klare goldene Farbe mit weißer Schaumkrone. Getreidiger, malziger Geruch. Geschmacklich getreidig, malzig, leicht grasig, gut versteckter Honig. Mittlere Süße mit leichter Bitterkeit, mittlerer Körper mit spürbarer Kohlensäure.

A commercial German classic. Clear yellow color, with a moderate and compact white head of medium persistance. The aroma is a mix of malty and grassy scents, with a dominance of cereals, bread and hay. The taste is consistent with the aroma, with a moderate malty flavor of salty bakery followed and balanced by a final dry and grassy-earthy bitterness, accompained by vague notes of walnuts. The body is medium to watery, with a medium carbonation and no alcoholic taste perceptible. In general this is a good commercial helles, not particularly exciting but very easy to understand and enjoy.

500ml bottle, online from Beer Merchants. Pours clear pale golden with a white head. Aroma: light malts, grains, straw, mild grass, caramel. Taste: light sweet & bitter, pale straw, mild grass, light bread. Light body with average carb. A bit dull tbh
Can. Pale, yellow lager, fine white head. Grassy, straw aroma. Dry taste, medium bitterness. F Mediu body, medium carbonation.Loral, grassy hop, light cracker aftertaste.
Kolor złoty z ładną pianą. W zapachu dominuje słód. W smaku słodowe, maślane. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.

Bright golden with a full white head that slowly disintegrates. 

Malty bread notes on the nose, clean and crisp.

Mildly carbonated, liquid bread, watered down to flatness. Medium bitter finish. 

Easy drink, a bit disappointed by the flatness
De cuerpo ligero y carbonatación media, la cerveza tiene un dedo de espuma de baja retención. Aroma a malta. Sabor ligeramente dulce con un leve amargor.

Aroma; pale straw, mild grass, caramel, malts, bread, mild grain. Look; off white head on clear pale golden body. Taste; pale straw, mild grass, caramel, malts, bread, mild grain, and finishes pale malted. Feel; normal body n co². Overall; it`s hellessssss deutschhhh :)) [eine  Flasche von einem dem nordischen Alkogetränkemonopol gekauft, und in der Wohnung der PywothekH7 getrunken]
Clear golden colour with a white head cereal  grainy aroma, medium body soft carbonation  bready malt hoppy finish

Bottle. Clear golden with a decent-looking, yet unstable off-white head. Aroma of mainly malt. Taste is gently sweet, low bitterness. Flavors of malt, grain, nuances of grass. Abrupt and very subtle hoppy finish. Full body, crisp texture, average carbonation.

500ml bottle. Clear, yellow-ish, pale golden colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, snow-white head. Grainy, strawy, minimally spicy, malty aroma. Taste is slightly dry, strawy, grainy malty and grassy hoppy, subtle hop bitterness.
Slightly oily texture, smooth and soft palate, fine and soft carbonation. 
Clean, simple and monotonous, well controlled sweetness - OK.
Can, 50 cl, SB Boländerna, Uppsala. Pleasant lager, clean, clear, yet interesting. Fine taste for its style.

Helle Farbe. Kleine Schaumkrone. Minimaler Geruch nach Gerste und minimal nach Früchten wie zb. Apfel. Sehr sanft auf der Zunge. Man hat einen minimalen Hopfen am Gaumen, der nach einiger Zeit schwächer wird. Ansonsten bleibt Geschmack von Gebackenen Brot auf der Zunge.
Its ok. Not my favourite as it didn't taste as crisp to the taste buds as others have. Still drinkable though.

50 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma of malt and marzipan. Good, "thick" mouthfeel. Again, very malty and rather sweet. Not much going on in the finish, which makes it feel a bit "thin". Still, a very enjoyable and easy-drinking beer.
Great pilsner. Crisp and refreshing. Hint of toffee and slightly sweet after taste.

Strong but light sweet bready biscuity malty and sulfury lager aroma with light spicy peppery hop
Pours a light clear golden color with frothy stable white head
Sweet bready grainy malt in flavor with well balanced spicy hop.
Medium light bodied with high co2,  lingering bitter spice finish.
Enjoyable Munich lager.  One is enough for me though as it doesn’t sit right in my stomach.
Gold with white not persistent head. Medium to low aroma, herbal malty. Sweet at first then good bitterness cleaning the mouth. Final hints of grains and malt

Can from the Packie labeled Munich Original Lager. 
Brilliantly clear deep gold in color with a large frothy head that persists.
Bready crackery maltiness earthy floral and a hint of fruit. Not too shabby.

Brilliant white foamy head stayed on a lively straw coloured body.
Cereal & grain aroma.
Medium bodied, soft on the tongue with sharp back.
Sweet fruits, cereal, grain & light malt tastes.
Clean!

I don't recall enjoying this as much previously. Very smooth and clean. Translucent mouthfeel. Soft and unassuming, good qualities to pair with a variety of meals where the beer doesn't need center stage. Enjoyable.

Bouteille de 50 cl achetée chez V&B. Robe dorée limpide avec une fine mousse blanche. Arômes maltés, citron et miel. Texture aqueuse, carbonatation moyenne, légère. Notes maltées, vanille et citron. Finale courte.

Classic pilsner, golden, clean and refreshing.
Goes down easy and very refreshing.

Хороший лагер, приятный вкус, умеренная насыщенность газом. Во вкусе доминирует практически чистый солод, плотность небольшая, хмелевой горечи почти нет. Пиво отлично идет под закуску с нежным вкусом.

Ottima Lager.
Colore chiaro, dissetante.
Consigliata sia a pasto ma anche fuori pasto.....sotto al sole.

Bottle from Beers Of Europe.
Pours a clear golden colour with a thin to medium sized throthy white head. Very low gentle carbonation. Faint aromas of cereals, hay, grass and bread. Taste is more of the same subtle notes as the aroma and a little biscuity. Light to medium bodied with a slight grassy bitter hop on the finish. No big flavours and a bit bland. Average lager.
Getreidig, fruchtig (insbesondere Zitrusnoten), recht bittere Hopfennote ab dem Mittelteil. Läuft dann etwas gallig aus. Eher auf der süffigen Seite. Gibt bessere Helle in München.
Pours clear Golden with a fluffy white head. Aroma of sweetened malt. Taste has weak lager notes, wheatiness, grassy hop notes. Palate has sweet malt, continuation of the yeast notes. Good.

A bit too much bready and bitter.
Plus for the appealing can with nice color, but thats about it.
Golden color, small white head. Aromas of bread, malt, herbs and grass. Taste of malt, bread, grass and minerals.

500 ml can. Bright, clean straw/gold color under a big, stiff, white head. Malts pretty prominent in the nose, even for a very light pale toast. Not much hop in the nose. Taste keeps the light malt coming. Just a little sweetness. This was packaged last October 15, but shows no faults  from aging. Just a slight German hop note that gets more detectable over the course of the cash, keeping balance with malt. Fine beer that survived import pretty tastily.

Bottle. Medium white head with poor retention. Light gold body. Nose is initially corn and sulphur. Then we have fruit, lager malt, a touch of lemon and some spice coming through. Bitter. Very crisp and refreshing. Dry finish.
It's a very good light beer. It's easy to drink, has a smooth taste. Color could be just a little bit darker, but it's one of the best all-arounders in the World.

Bottiglia da 0,50. Schiuma scarsa e volatile. Colore giallo chiaro. Carbonatura media ed adeguata. Aromi di legno, grano, castagne ed erba essiccata. Gusto morbido ma deciso. Lager dalla media gradazione. Finale breve e deciso. Consiglio 5/10

Ein Bier, das man fast überall bekommt. Das zeigt sich schon an dem vielsprachigen Etikett.
Ein recht gemütliches BIer, das aber nicht wirklich sehr in die Tiefe geht. Es hat einen gemütlichen getreidigen Kern, aber es fehlt an feinen Aromen.
Kann man trinken - besonders um sich zu betrinken - aber wirkliche Überraschungen und Freuden bringt es nicht.

The model of a classic German helles, Munich Gold delivers a clean malty experience with a healthy dose of spicy continental hops and a clean even fade. Bready notes and dry hay prevail. Pours a perfect clear golden with a thick fluffy head. Balanced in every sense of the word. This beer would be at home with or without food, in hot or cold weather, on a beach or on a hike. It's a great all-arounder.

Burk 500 ml från Systembolaget. Ljust guldfärgad med vitt skum som sedan lägger sig. Doft av malt, halm och citrus. Smak av malt, bröd, honung, örter och citrus. Medelstor beska med en frisk eftersmak med inslag av citrus.

Metro Cash & Carry Moldova 32,8 lei - 0,5 l 
Aromă de hamei, ierburi uscate, pîine. Gust uşor amar de hamei, fîn, malţ prăjit. Un Helles standard
Halmgul klar vätska med vitt skum. Svag doft av bröd. Söt inledande i smaken som sedan möter en låg men ren och neutral beska.
Can from Systembolaget. A reasonable enough helles that went down smoothly alongside a Fifa victory

Can. Clear golden brown with medium egg shell white head. Aroma of bread, light earth, toast, light hay and light corn. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of toast, grain and light earth. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Fine but run-of-the-mill.
500 ml can poured at home. Gold with white head. Smells and tastes like hay. Sweetish finish with a touch of grassy bitterness.
Ljusgul med tunt vitt skum. Doftar lite malt, hö och halm. Smaken fyllig, lite söt. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång, lite söt och besk.
On tap at the Teddington Arms. Pours bright gold with lively carbonation and nice white froth. Aromas of biscuit and malt, with some citrus tastes and faintly sweet finish.
Gyllengul klar vätska med medelhögt vitt skum. brödiga smaker, lite surdeg, lätt gräsig beska. Ganska trist exempel på massproducerad lager. Ok-
W aromacie słodowe, czuć chmiel, nuty trawiaste i chlebowe. W smaku słodowe z krótką i niską goryczką. Lekko słodkawe.
Lund burk SB. Mörkare än övriga helles. Frisk doft med underton av blöt papp. Bra balans malt mot beska. Mager aromhumle.

Butelka 0,5 l. Piwo jasnozłote, klarowne. Piana biała, obfita, gęsta, trwała, z niezła koronką. W aromacie nuty siana, kukurydziane słodu pilzneńskiego, chlebowe, gdzieś w tle odrobina lubczyku czy tam maggi. W smaku lagerowo czyste, słodowość, chleb, lekki posmak sianka. Pełnia niska, wysycenie średnie do średnio wysokiego, goryczka bardzo niska. Nie powala,ale trzyma poziom i robi robotę, zapewne o to chodzi w hellesie.

Cannned. Yellow and clear, head incredlibly low. Taste - okay, grassy, bit hoppy, but overall somehow weak to be honest. Light too, expected "stronger" taste.
Not bad, but expected little more.

Can from Systembolaget.
Clear pale golden. 
Sweetish malty aroma with hay, marzipan and some sour weeds.
Taste is clean with white bread and grass. Fairly low bitterness.
Quite thin/firm body with sharp bubbles.
Feels commercial and shallow. Drinkable though.

Light golden color, weak white head. 
Typical Münchner Lager aroma: sweet malty nose. 
Taste is sweet malty, with light, noble bitterness. Full bodied, well balanced beer. Good mouthfeel, medium carbonation. 
A standard.

500ml can poured into a pint glass. Appearance is clear pale golden with a medium-sized off-white head. Aroma of grains, cereal, bread and a hint of grass. Taste is medium sweet and light-medium bitter. Palate is light bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Overall okay,  lacking in hops.
Sweet malt, some lemon. Just bready flavour. Lacks hops, feels too sweet. Won't buy next time, absolutely nothing special.
Fin skumkrona, ölen har en något svag ton i färgen, första smakbilden är bra (ngt matig) men eftersmaken av bröd och apelsin stör helhetsintrycket. Blir bättre.
Clear golden appearance. Aroma is hops, sweet and malt. Flavour is hops, citrus and malt.

Bottle. Aroma- bready and grainy maltiness, maybe with delicate herbal notes. Pale, clear, with a medium-high, creamy head. Taste- not bad, feels like a Dortmunder Export. Again bready notes play the main role. On the other hand, I'm missing some hoppiness, which could counter the malty side. No bitterness. Low bodied, with a low carbonation. Simple, correct, but quite dull Lager.
Złociste klarowne piwo z z niezłą pianą która dość szybko opada. Aromat zbożowy, w smaku podobnie delikatne nuty zboża i trawy. Niezły monachijski hell
Barwa złota, klarowna. Piana wysoka tylko przez chwilę, potem opada do zera. Goryczka prawie niewyczuwalna, lekki dms.
Great beer,golden color but tastes more like darker beer with bready aroma. I liked it a lot.

pretty alright industrial lager aroma, just a bit more hoppier than the typical industrial lager. looks like a typical lager. small white head. very nice taste, taste of hops. better than your average lager. a bit watery, not too big of a fan of that. 500ml can poured into a glass
Butelka 0,5 litra, zakupiona w Auchan. Barwa złota, klarowna. Średnia, biała piana, szybko opada. W smaku wyraźna słodowość, goryczka średnia.

Shared pint can poured to snifters showing a clear & bright, golden hue, with a bubbly layer of soft white froth, and foamy spots of lacing. The nose was soft grain, Pils scent, with slight hints of spice & pear. Light to medium bodied, with lively carbonation, the taste was similar, adding a low but effective bitterness that was grainy, and subtly earthy. A very clean & drinkable Helles.

500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 4.9%. Pallid yellow-gold. Decent-sized, decent-lasting head. Grassy, malty, corny aromas. Moderate carbonation. Spicy, grassy, hop-dominated lager, which makes a change! Bitterness and sweetness well balanced, with the lager malt only really making itself known in the end of the mouthful, mostly just acting as a backbone to the hops and rounding the experience out quite well. One of the best Helles I've drunk. Unmistakably a lager, and unmistakably well-made.

50cl can, but tasted on several other occasion and sources. Pale golden color, crystal clear, average white head. 330 ml bottle into lager glass, best before 7/2019. Pours fairly crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and rocky off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice thick spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of cracker, white bread dough, biscuit, and light honey/toast, wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. A bit of fruity/yeasty aromas, but not overwhelming. Nice aromas with good balance of bready malt and earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of cracker, white bread dough, biscuit, and light honey/toast, wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, woody, floral, grassy, peppery bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, white bread dough, biscuit, and light honey/toast, wood, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great robustness and balance of bready malt and earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and no lingering hop astringency after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Very clean on lager flavors, minimal fruity/yeasty notes. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth and moderately bready/grainy/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.9%. Overall this is a delicious Munich helles style. All around nice robustness and balance of bready malt and earthy hop flavors; very smooth, refreshing, and fairly crisp/clean to drink with the moderately bitter/drying finish. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Perfectly balanced between clean/nicely rich pils/munich malts and earthy noble hops. Mild residual sweetness with lingering crisp dryness. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example as expected.

Paulaner is also a monastic brew, fermenting itself info existing in the Nuedeck monastery in 1629. My favourite Munich hellbier so far, on this evidence, and I like most I've tried. It looks like a normal lager--golden yellow with a small firm head--but it smells rich and malty, and the flavour is strong and characterful. You taste shortbread at first, and this sweetness dries to more of a peppery breadiness on the back end. This is the perfect example of a helles, in my opinion, with malts predominant, adding a honeyish tone. Yet despite being rich, malty, and sweet, none of those notes are overdone, making this a paragon of blending--a power taste bound in by fine restraint, with complex flavours reshuffling as they journey across the palate in a kaleidoscope of differing colours. A beer that makes me smile as I drink.

Hellgelb bis Gelb, brilliant. Feinporig, weißer Schaum. Hopfenblumige Aromen, malzig, süßlich. Schmeckt nach Honig. Schlanker Körper, weich, süffig. Ein solides, süßes Helles. 0,5l-Flasche am 26.1.18

The problem with Munich style lagers is that they are good fresh, the time this beer spends sitting on the shelf in the store influences its taste a lot. However, not too shabby but nothing out of the decent average.

11.2floz bottle, BBD: end of 01.2018, $1.75 unit cost, pint glass. A basic German pale lager that appears straw in color with a white head.The aroma is of dried grass. Tastes like hay and the body is light and mild.

A bottle from City Super in the basement of Sogo on Zhong Xiao Fu Xing. Aroma: sourdough. Appearance: clear gold, same colour as the label; white lacing. Palate:light-bodied and slick, average carbonation, predominantly bitter at the finish. Taste: medium-bitter, clean finish, respectable.

Incredibly crisp and refreshing lager. Malt doesn’t linger; it sticks around for the bit and then its off. Well balanced. Drank extremely cold in the extreme cold (haha) on the last day of the outdoor “German” Christmas market. Crappy plastic cup, but good lager, to be fair!

Bottle from Beerwulf online. Golden beer with large foam head. Aroma of....well it's hard to describe. It smells and tastes like a helles or any other type of lager should. Clean, crisp and fresh. Very good.

Bottle at Beerdock Leek. Pours a golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of cereal, slight bready malts and subtle grass. Taste of cereal, some bready malts, slight grass and subtle butter. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A soft, dry, cereal malt bitterness in the finish. A typical german helles really. Decent.
Svijetlo zuta boja, veoma prozirno. Postojana debela bijela pjena. Citrusne arome, naročito limun, osjeti se aroma meda i kvasca. Srednje karbonizacije i gorčine, vodene teksture.
Clean, crisp lager profile of wet grains, grassy herbs, bread and lemon-ish zest. Will quench your thirst.

I drank this on tap in the hotel bar from Arcadia Hotel at the Munich Airport,
Clear golden beer with very short small white head, taste not special, boring,

Ar: Crackers and dried mixed flowers; subtle notes of sulfur, toast, and chalk. Ap: Yellow-gold and crystal clear; very large off-white head with phenomenal retention, leaving an airy cap of foam and spotted lacing along the glass sides. T: Clean cracker malt with a bit of a toast edge; lightly sweet; a touch of sulfur; bitterness is low and clean, with a dried flower flavor, a little rosy; black pepper and a fuller, lightly toasty maltiness toward the middle and into the finish; chalk, floral hops, and bitterness on the finish. P: Medium-light body with high carbonation; dry finish. O: Simply a well-made helles lager; malt-focused, even though the flavor is delicate and light; just enough bitterness and hop flavor to balance; very clean fermentation profile, and quite easy-drinking and refreshing.
Bottle - pale yellow, medium with very small white head. Small lemony aroma. Ting on tongue and in mouth. Slightly tangy tasting, but standard lager basically - very thin.
Tipica hell industriale, colore oro, aroma di malto cereali, al palato è debole, malto, note metalliche, cerealose. Carbonazione media.

500 ml bottle from a supermarket in Favignana, Sicily, Italy. It pours clear yellow, with a nice, white head. Aroma is malts, cereals, bread, notes of grass. Presence of some light hops. Taste is medium bitter. Body is light to medium, carbonation is average.

It’s a little hoppy for me and I’m not fond of the aftertaste. Still searching for the perfect Lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromă ușoară, malț, cereale încolțite, paie proaspete, ceva ierburi și frunze. Gust ușor, puțin amar (frunze), malț, paie uscate, cereale. Bună și curată.

From Feb 2006

Poured from the bottle a light gold with a large head of foam that dissipated slowly.

The only smell I could get was of slight malt and yeast.

The taste is nice and malty up front with a good dose of hops midway to make for a good balance. But...after a few sips, the beer kind of falls flat and becomes a bit boring. I see the bottle date is Aug of 05 so I'll have to retry it if I can find a fresher sample.
Overall...even at 6 months, it's not a bad drop.
From tap at Paulaner am Dom, Frankfurt. Clear yellow golden color with white head. Malty aroma, hay, grainy. Sweet and light bitter taste. Light thin to oily body with soft to average carbonation.

500ml can as "Paulaner Münchner Hell" bought at 7-Eleven on Nelson Street, Mong Kok.



Looks: Clear pale golden colour; Three finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 4 minutes; Very good sticky lacing with active slight carbonation.



Aroma: Pungent full Lager malt, with grains, strong floral, light malt sugar, strong bread, lemon and strong grass.



Taste: Close to medium sweet malt, with floral, sugar, light herbal, bread, lemon, fair to medium bitter hops and grass.



Body: Mid to light body. Slick and slightly creamy palate.



Mouth Feel: Good Lager maltyness in slick, slightly watery background. Simple and clean tasting with floral and fair sweetness. Light herbal and bread with fair lemon to round. Not bad! 



Hoppiness: Strong floral, lemon and strong grass in nose. Herbs, floral, light lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness is fairly light for an abrupt, light astringent sweet bitter malty finish. 



After Taste: Quite dry. Herbal grassy and slightly bitter to mouth.



Comments: As a Helles, this big boy is simple - perhaps too simple - but play it safe with expressive Hallertau aroma and fairly herbal taste. Yet, without any honey / cookie elements, its watered down body is glaringly exposed. Probably one of the most hoppiest Helles around, I just wish its maltyness can be fuller and more colorful. An easy Summer beer for me.



P.S. Wash all RateBeerians a Happy Oktoberfest and Mid-Autumn!

Bottle. Clear golden colour. Thick white head. Aroma of bread and grain. Light body and moderate carbonation. Well balanced crisp and sweet (sort of like wheat beer sweetness). Malty sweet in the aftertaste.

Had this many times over the years. Rating only now. Clear golden, diminishing off-white head. Moderate grainy and grassy aromas in balance, light vegetable. Crisp, slightly dusty. Medium body, moderate carbonation, balanced finish. Not unpleasant, even nicely hopped.

Malts, herbs and flowers in nose. Pours golden with white head. Taste is medium dry to medium sweet with malty notes followed by herbs and flowers. Low to medium somewhat earthy bitter finish, lively carbo. Overall decent brew.

лагерьок такий собі легкий і питкий опісля роботи. але пляшка якайсь інша була

golden, clear, light sweetness, lightly bitter,
Bottle in Germany. Quite nice helles, sweet grain, malt and floral hops, easy drinking, ok brew

Spicy and medicinal hop aroma dominate the nose. There is a malty background to this aroma. Clear golden colour with frothy white head. Light bitterness and light body. The carbonation is soft and the finish is long. This is an excellent beer. Complex, balanced, and very easy to drink.

Bottle, 50cL. 4.9%. Purchase ("VandB", @Châtellerault, FR). Home. A pale golden clear beer ; average bubbly ; medium white head with a medium retention ; ok lacing. Herb, light vegetable, malty notes, lemon note. Light sweet, light dry bitter refreshing. Light body, thin texture, aerage good carbonation, dry herbal fresh finish. Overall, average.
Большое разочарование от Paulaner. Пиво на вкус совершенно не соответствует классу. Слегка противное солодовое послевкусие. В общем уныние...
bread, cereal, floral, herbs, golden, clear, frothy, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, soft carbonation,

With only Munich-based breweries being allowed to produce and market "Münchner Helles" the expectation with respect to its quality is high. I do think it is indeed a good, easy to drink, tasty Helles, I am however not able to taste the difference between a Münchner and any other Hell.

Bottle from Rewe, Saarburg, Rhineland Palatinate, Germany!


Pours yellow with a solid head. Aroma has hay, sweet grain and flowery hops. Taste is sweet grainy, crisp malts, flowery hop notes. Sweet grainy finish!
11.2 oz bottle. Pours straw, light carbonation, minimal head. Slight skunk nose. Bitter but smooth and clean. Slight linger. Not great, not terrible.

500 ml bottle. Best before 05/18. Crystal clear golden coloured brew with a stable fluffy head that leaves foam flakes in the glass. The aroma was grainy, spicy malts and honeycomb. The flavor was initially unpleasant metallic, later it reshaped into subtle grassy hops, grain and malts. Soft texture, average carbonation, light body. Almost clean, but not a perfect helles.
There’s certainly worse lager or pilsener. A hint of grapefruit. However, it remains a lager, which is hardly the most exciting out there.

26. 8. 2017, Zagreb, Ikea. Bottled. Almost no aroma at all. Very lightbodied and low carbonation, easily drinkable. Taste at start is full so I would say this is one of the better lagers having a slightly bitter finish which is still noticable in the aftertaste. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear gold color with a big head. Aroma is bready, grainy, and yeasty. Taste clean, grainy, and very drinkable. Slight bitter finish. Good beer, for a mass market.
Botella 33 cl del c Inglés Oviedo tomada en Oviedo junio 2000. Lote L22903L hasta 08..2001. (r1157). Cereales. Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber más menos fino. Buena.

On tap at Wild Brumby, Jindabyne. Pours a pale wheat gold with a thin white head. Easy drinking. Thin body. Moderate to high carbonation. Easy drinking, but just a good standard lager, nothing amazing.
Bottle @ home. Clear hell colour, white foam. Malty, light sweet, bit watery. Light notes of cardboard. Easy drinkable. Ok Helles.

500 ml can. Clear bright golden colour, medium head with average durability, some lacing, soft carbonation. Nose is sweetish malt, cereal. Flavour is light sweet, the hoppy bitterness is dominating. Rather watery in the mouth with a short finish. Nothing special here.
Dobar, iako preferiram vodenjastije lagere.....................................

(500 ml bottle) Pours a crystal-clear light golden beer, with fine carbonation, and a thin white head. The aroma is typical of a German helles: biscuit, bread, noble hops, a hint of honeycomb, and some underlying buckwheat. Sweet and crisp, with a clean bitter finish. The mouthfeel is smooth and light, making this a very refreshing beer.

Overall, this is a good helles. It’s slightly more hopped than other examples I’ve tried, striking a fresh balance between bitter and sweet. Easy drinking.
Slight buttery aromas, soft corn, grainy. Clear gold with a fairly lasting white head. Pretty sweet, grainy, light grassy hops. Light bodied.

F: medium size, average retention, white.
C: yellow to very pale gold, clear.
A: malty, grassy, bit of caramel, bit of fruity, honey.
T: malty, bready, sweet fruity, mild hop spicy, mineral, nothing very special but for the style ok beer, medium body, low to medium carbonation, enjoyed, 0,5l can as “Paulaner Münchner Hell” from REWE supermarket in Perl in Germany.
Pleasant and easy drinking, good head, decent carbonisation and a grassy, wheaty aroma and flavour.

On tap in Piory Arms, Stockwell. Very clear pale amber, with a medium white foam head. Nose is light grassy, straw, sweet toasted grains, cereal malt. Taste is sweet toast grain, dried grass, straw, cereal malts, little hop bite. Got more flavour than macros. Solid lager.

Dorado claro, bastante transparente y con buena carbonatación. Casi ausente en nariz, salvo por la gran cantidad de maiz. Más bien plana en boca con mucho dulce de malta y un punto cítrico. Sensación pesada en boca. Baja bebestibilidad.

Dégustée avec mon cher Appiantiqua en pression: belle robe dorée surmontée d’une mousse blanche avec une forte carbonatation.Le nez nous offre des arômes de céréales avec une bonne amertume qui arrive en bouche nous laissant sur une finale très rafraîchissante et bien agréable.Une bonne bière blonde!14,5/20

Dégustée en pinte pression avec mon petit Kittenbieer.
Température de début 6 à 7°.
Belle robe dorée surmontée d’une mousse blanche de persistance moyenne; carbonatation intense.
Nez léger mais plutôt agréable sur les malts et les houblons.
Le goût est aussi plaisant avec une amertume appréciable et des saveurs de céréales le tout dans un bon équilibre.
La finale de bonne longueur est caractéristique des Lager de bonne facture.
Une bonne bière de brasserie.
12/20

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow colored liquid with a medium to large white head. Aroma of sweet malts, grass, flowers, some metal hints and hay. Taste is low to medium bodied and malt sweet. Flavors of malt, grass, spice, slight notes of wheat and hay. Finish has a slight metallic bitterness.

Can: 500 ml, Price: 1,16 eur 

Skaidri geltona aukso spalva, balta puta..

On tap at Neuschwanstein
Clear goldish color. Small head, I’m getting used to this. It tastes very! watery. No surprise it can be drank in liters on oktoberfest.
Goldgelb im Glas, leicht perlig mit schwacher Schaumkrone. Der Antrunk leicht malzig, wenig Würze und nur leicht gehopft. Ein wässriger Durstlöscher!

Originally rated on 12/18/08. It poured a very clear, pale yellow body with average carbonation and a mid sized cap. Aroma of sweet malts, wheat, and a little grass. Flavor was similar to the aroma with the slightest hop presence giving it a little bite. Overall this is an ok lager.
OK-ish lager. There’s certainly worse lager or pilsener. A hint of grapefruit. However, it remains a lager, which is hardly the most exciting out there.

On tap at ’Salvator’. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish, a little grassy-spicy aroma of straw and honey. Sweetish, slightly grassy-spicy taste of straw, some honey and a bit of caramel, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly grassy-spicy finish. Medium body, slightly creamy and a little effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

Bottle at the Edelweiss Cafe, George Town, Penang. Poured a crystal clear straw colour with a frothy short-lived white head. The aroma is malt, light woody hop. The flavour is moderate to light bitter with a light crisp dry cardboard mineral malt, light hop bitter palate. Medium to light bodied with average carbonation.
Draft pour. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. Good head retention. The aroma is crisp and herbal. I get a moderate sweetness from it. Medium body and medium carbonation. Refreshing.
Golden colour, medium white head. Grain, citrus, hay, bread. Medium bitter with sweet hint. Soft carbonated. Grainy finish. Not bad.
Bought at systembolaget Charlottenberg. Light colour, german lager taste, one of my favorite lagers
Bottle, Marks and Spencer, Enderby. Golden with a white head. Corny with herbal, grassy character. Lemon with floral notes. Bready yeast. Good lager.

Well, I didn?t drink this one as I should have I guess: quite warm, already drunk, difficult to rate and really enjoy then. Still not very impressed, strong wheat taste, rather common and quite basic... Better than most other industrial lagers certainly, but not especially memorable... PARTIALLY APPROVED BY TAVERNY?S BLACK METAL CREW!
Bottle. Very clear, brilliantly. Light golden color. Nice aroma, light grain, some sweetness. Malty flavor, but not overly malt forward. Herbal hop flavor. Straight-forward. Nice.

Pours a light gold with a small white head. Nose is bready grainy malts with a hint of lemon. Taste is similar, touch of hops, nice bready malt finish. Excellent Lager, simple, fresh ingredients, refreshing and tasty.
clear dark golden colour , realy realy thin head , almost no head at all, aroma of malt , tastes lika a proper lager.

Bottle @ Andy’s, Munich. Clear golden pour with a white head. Pronounced cereal and general grain on the nose. Light pepper and a bit of dough. Flavor is towards the sweeter end of the spectrum, but fairly well balanced and still quite crisp. Dry grass, a touch of hay. Sweet malt. Light and easy drinking, prickly carb. Solid.

Clear light golden under a fluffy white head. Crisp light almost nothing nose that’s just lightly lagery and grainy. Flavor is the same. Crisp and lightly grainy and smooth and golden, very balanced and gentle and light. Pretty much what it’s supposed to be.

Pas vraiment mauvaise cette lager allemande mais à mon avis dans les limites du genre. La blonde est limpide, les arômes très pauvres, les saveurs "pils", la bouche fraîche et la finale avec une petite amertume.
Deep golden tight head, sweet bready aroma taste to follow malty clean with gentle bitter balance mild hint of citrus. V Nice.
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours clear golden, nose is cereal, grassy, lemon, taste is similar.
Pours golden clear with medium white top. Aroma is malty, sourish, dust, some ash, grains. Taste is malty, grainy, some cardboard, balanced, natural, white bread. Nice and classical.

Bottle, from Marks & Spencer. Pale gold, fluffy and sustaining white head, gentle condition. Pleasant chalky mineral notes, grain and some fruity hoppiness in the nose, quite soft and sweet in the mouth with a pleasant tingle of hop bitterness and some muted grain notes. Finish has a muted chalky bitterness and a little peppery hoppiness lingering.

Butelka 500ml. Zloty kolor. Piana biala,srednia kadnie utrzymuje sie w szkle. W zapachu ziarniste z kukurydza i kartonem w tle. Pierwszy lyk oleisty...slodkawy o ziarnisto-trawiastej nucie. Niezla karbonacja. Ok
Ottima Birra lager! Per me una lager può essere da 5/5. Non capisco perchè per avere un voto alto una birra debba per forza di cose essere super particolare.

Bottle, 0.5l. Clear golden pour with soapy one finger white head with poor retention and ok lacing. Malty, herbal smell. Earthy with some cardboard presence.

Medium body with watery texture, softly carbonated. Taste is bittersweet, but very mild and light. Aroma is malty, grainy and herbal. Pleasant, but heavily subdued. 

Overall, watered down lager. Lacking in taste, but the little taste that comes through is nice and refreshing. Good thirst quencher, not a beer to savour slowly.
Boca 0.5L - mislim da je iz Bille, lager kao lager, nema se tu šta puno filozofirati, malo izraženiji okus po ječmu...dobro ohladiti i udri!!!
Tap@Taphouse, Copenhagen - golden pour with white head. Aroma and taste is sweet bready malt, some straw, hay, cereal, sweet malty and grassy hoppy notes into the close.

Amarelo ouro, translúcida, espuma branca de média formação e persistência. Aroma predominante de cereais, paladar de corpo leve e média carbonatação. Final refrescante, média persistência, um ótimo exemplar do estilo.
Cereal malt body with a bit of vanilla and an earthy yeast and a crisp finish.
[backlog] 23-09-15 // bottle at Domsgickel, Mainz. Pours a clear golden colour, small white head. Light body. Light malty. Smooth.

Pours crystal clear, golden to light amber with normal sized white head that lasts. Aroma of sweet grains, malts, European hops (floral). Taste is sweet grains, a bit of baked brad. Finish is crisp and malty. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Nice but nothing special.
0.5l bottle. Malty aroma. Clear yellow color, small white head. Malty taste, bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation and bitter finish. Ok.

Bouteille de 50 cl (titre à 4,6%). Couleur dorée, mousse assez abondante de tenue moyenne. Céréales et sucre, carbonnation moyenne, rien de bien particulier, on ne grimace pas en la buvant. Trouvée à V ’n B - Hénin Beaumont.

Yellow body with white head.

Tap. Clear golden colour with unstable head off. Aroma of malts,caramel. Taste of grain,malts,watery body, more sweet than bitter.
Light crisp lager smell, taste is great smooth sweet malt...light and doesn’t linger long...nice drinkable beer...refreshing...just as light as I would want a beer

Pours golden with white head. Aroma is grainy malt. Flavor is sweet grainy malt with crisp finish and bready yeast.
Bottle. Yellow with medium white head. Wheat and yeast aroma, Sweet malt flavour, hay notes

500ml can in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a light golden yellow. Nice aroma, sweet , bready, grass. Tastes light and airy. Slightly sour. Average carbonation that dissipates. A nice premium beer. Very refreshing.

500 ml bottle. Golden colour with big slowly shrinking white head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, lemon. Flavor is fruits, some spice. Finish is hoppy (herbal and spicy). Lingering fruit. Medium body, soft mouthfeel and average carbonation.
500ml bottle. Pours bright gold with a large head. Aroma is sweet with straw. Taste is sweet with straw and grain.

Közepes, tartós hab, borostyán szín. Enyhe, lágeres, gyümölcsös illat. Kissé édeskés, malátás ízvilág, a háttérben kissé zöldfüves aromával. Közepesen testes és szénsavas, enyhén keserű. Finom, jól eltalált, ivósör.
Pale yellow, clear. Malts, hay and hops on the nose. Malts and cereal, refreshing and easy to drink but not watery. Good for what it is but nothing impressive.
Golden body with large head. Malty and spicy nose. Taste of malts and some fruits. Dry finish.

Better than the mass produced light lagers. But still lacking enough flavour to be a great beer. The style needs to be pushed a little harder for flavour and not popularity. Can in Munich.

I still think it’s a bit astringent with that bad oktoberfest-like taste. D&S Dresden (3.1 sept 2019)

Fresh bottle from Sommel Dresden. Nice but not perfect. Upgraded to 3.3

DATE: August 5, 2016... OCCASION: The Olympic opening ceremonies begin, while I wait for Jerry and Matt to arrive... GLASSWARE: Ommegang pokal... crystal clear, imperial golden body that has a fleeting, off-white head that takes the form of uneven suds...solitary bubbles... a perfumed lightly, aromatically hopped--lilac and with crisp cracker malts making for an invitation... smooth, light, slightly syrupy, but highly drinkable and uninhibited... a light-bodied lager that dissipates without much of a draw or drag... the taste profile is soft and apologetic, with less of a "hearty" impact than expected... a bit beefy, with the vegetable and butter flavors of an honest lager... as Paulaners go, no match for the hefe, but a pleasantly light lager that has hints of toasted bread, flowers and dry champagne...
can @ supermarket (budapest) golden colour, medium body, normal carbonated, hoppy, bitter, but no so special for my taste

Bottle. Wine Rack, Sharrow, Sheffield. Dark gold label showing Paulaner Münchner Hell Munich Lager. Crystal clear, bright gold. Thin, bubbly, white head. Nose has sweet grain. Light, leafy hop. Thin sick. Taste is bready sweet. Minimal bitterness. Clean enough mouthfeel. Light body. Finish has some dryness. Ok. Prefer a German lager to have more grassy hop, though.
Uma boa lager. Refrescante e bem maltada e com leve amargor. Cor dourada e espuma branca.

Farbe gold

Geschmack: sprudlig bitter, im Abgang etwas süße und dann wieder dominant bitter mit Gerste.
Nicht spektakulär, bisserl bitter für mich, aber gut.
33cl bottle, clear pale golden color, medium white head, bready malt aroma, grass and citrus notes, balanced flavor, light to medium body, dry finish, basic drinkable

330ml bottle into shaker. Bottle says ’Original Munich Lager’. Crystal clear amber beer with thin film of suds on top, light but steady carbonation. Nose is stale cardboard and boredom. Full body, grainy and bitter taste. Finish is more cardboard, sour bread and distant malt. Right at the end some spicy hop notes appear. Designed as an easy-drinking quaffer but not one I would choose.

Enjoyed: On tap.
Appearance: Clear golden colour, with regular white foam.

From Club del Gourmet of El Corte Ingles of El Duque. In Teku glass. After dinner. Very drinkable, although feels watery and a bit more sweet then desiderable.
Очень приятное пиво, натуральный вкус, аромат, послевкусие все хорошо, пьется легко, утоляет жажду, рекомендую!

50cl can from SuperAlko, Tallinn. Pours crystal clear pale golden without much head to speak of. Mild malty aroma with slightly fruity notes and hints of grass and honey. Moderate sweet with rather mild grainy flavours and a light bitterness. Fair enough - easy to drink and somewhat refreshing.

16 oz draft pours a light golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of sweet malt, light grain. Light bodied, crisp and refreshing

Can from a friend. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, toast, earthy notes, grass and malts. Bitter finish with citrus, toast, grass and malts. Solid hell.
Golden with a white head - Malt in the aroma - malt body with hints of hops and low bitterness - Malt in the finish that is on the sweet side - This was nice

Butelka 0.5l (10.2016). Klarowne, zlociste, biala piana, nietrwala. Typowy koncerniak bez aromatu i goryczki, leciutko slodowy z wyraznym slodkawym posmakiem. Pijalne, nawet lekko orzezwiajace, przecietne.
Grains, honey, grass, clear golden with a good white head not persistant, light body, medium carbonation, taste of grass, honey, bitter final...just a paulaner, very refreshing.
Bottle. Pours clear gold color with white head. Aroma of grass, reisin, herbs. Light carbonation, light body.

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, España.
A: Golden / Dorado.

Can at home. Straw yellow colour with a medium white head. Nose is grainy, with some slight sourness. Taste is dominated by malts, with some light caramel and bread. Nice refreshing malt forward lager.
0,5l bottle. Pours clear golden withwhite head. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Sweet, fresh and a bit fruity taste. A bit bitter and dry end.
500ml bottle. Pours clear golden color with small white head. Aroma of malt, floral and hops. Light body with average carbonation. Taste is light bitter.
Can. Clear golden color, white head. Aroma has malts and some crispy hops. Taste has malts and crispy hops.
Crisp straw and grain aroma. A clear light golden body Sharp white head about two fingers to start. Creamy smooth grain light malt taste. Crisp and refreshing. Excellent light bodied brew.

Very clear light golden beer with average white head. Grainy/bready malts dominate the aroma, even a bit cardboard. Herbal hops in the background. The texture is a bit too thin, the body a bit light. Yet the beer lacks the smooth drinkability that other beers of this style have. I think the original is beat, others are better!

Can from Seoul Plaza. Aroma cardboard, raw grainy, rusty iron (metallic). Clear golden colour, moderate white head, long retention. Taste is very empty and watery, only lightly parading the off-flavours, cardboard and iron. Light bitterness and very light grassy sharp hops flavour. Thin bodied and almost moderate carbonation. Definitely nothing I would order again.

Draft. Yellow in color with a one finger white head. Grainy aroma with a touch of honey. Mild sweet flavor, grainy, simple. Lighter bodied with average carbonation. Above average but fairly standard helles.
Very nice lager. I find it very hoppy for the style, which I liked. Refreshing and drinkable.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 4A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch L29356H. AROMA: moderate-low grainy-sweet malt aroma with a faint herbal hop note. slight metalic aroma. APPEARANCE: gold color and translucent. creamy white head with average retention. TASTE: initial malty sweet flavor with a grainy character. very faint herbal hop note. medium-low bitterness with a moderate malty and slightly bitter finish. PALATE: medium-light body with average carbonation. OVERALL: a standard munich helles with the traditional characteristics.
Paulaner Original Münchner its wonderfully subtle, spicy, naturally hearty taste.

Aroma is really harsh. Some moist-grassy hops and earthy cheese. Taste is mostly water (sorry) with a little bitterness in the end. However a full body with well-tempered carbonation. All in all: not my favourite.

Gee-gosh-golly, wish this was available in 12-pak format (like the Hefe-Weizen, Marzen and Wiesn are) because this here is a really easy beer to enjoy. This is what I suspect some pale lagers currently manufactured  would someday like to be like, or should be.
5000 ml bottle. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Light bread, some honey and grassy notes. Medium/high co2. Finishes dry and a bit spicy.

Bought as "Paulaner Münchner Hell". Bottled May 2015.
L: Pours clear pale color between yellow and green. Thick two fingers white head disappears quickly. Carbonation is low.
S: Tender warm smell of fresh baked bread, baked pork, with some hops on the background.
T: Rich taste of dough and oats with nice hoppy aftertaste.
F: Fits the style.
O: Very good helles, rich in taste and refreshing. I’d highly recomend to try it.
3/6/2009 7:48:31 AM Bottle in Munich. Golden body with large head. Malty and spicy nose. Taste of malts and some fruits. Dry finish.

0.5 l can from Germany. Beautiful sparkling golden color with thin head. Hoppy, refresing aroma & taste. Medium bodied, yet easily drinkable with an average carbonation. Relatively long finishing. One of my favoite lagers.

0,5l can. Golden colour with big slowly shrinking white head. Aroma: hay, alcohol. Taste: Bitter but not very good, a bit watery. One dimensional. Light/medium body, medium carbonation. Dry finish. Not very good.
Gezapft in einem Münchner Restaurant, goldgelber Körper mit schmalen Schaumrand, sehr mild, leicht bitter, leichtes getreidiges Aroma. Okay, aber austauschbar
500 ml bottle. Pale golden colour. Very good beer - light, yeasty, bready and fruity, with nice finish. Refreshing. Makes you wanna drink more and more.

It is a classical beer, a standard one.The color is yellow clear and weak foam, average carbonation. There is a side bitter, metalic with some hop, malty but the taste of alcohol is stronger. It is not the best from paulaner. The final taste in the mouth is not pleasant. I drank it this beer again in Verona that you find in a lot of places. I drink some of this beer at the terme giugnone, close to Verona. I think that it is a honest beer, the best for these hot days, metalic touch but aromatic hop, giving this typical German bitterness that your throat loves it.
On holiday in Germany gold blond colored body with a small white head and with a spicy fruity hop aroma a spicy herby hop fruity taste with a bitter finish
On tap at the Bavarian Brauhaus, Glasgow. A full flavoured, fruity, grassy, medium sweet but refreshing lager. Medium bodied.

Aroma: herbs and malty notes.
Apppearance: clear really straw color and thim white head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness (slightly stalky), malty notes, quite empty and dry.
Palate: low body and high carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Average stuff, that’s all.
Gutes, aber austauschbares Helles. Aromen von gutem Malz, voller Körper, etwas süßlich.

In short: sticky caramel beer.
Aroma: caramel, lemon zest.
Apperance: crystal golden with white foam.
Taste: light sweet.
Palate: sticky bitter finish, hints of wood.

500ml bottle. 
L: pours a pale gold, very clear, nice carbonation, good finger of white foam. 
S: a very bright nose of lager malt, a touch of sweetness like a white grape, and lemony. It kinda has a lemonade/shandy vibe. 
T: the malt is forward and clean, slightly grainy, and it tails out with a light hop feel and lingering wheat with light spice. 
F: the feel is light and crisp, very easy to drink. 
O: it pairs well with spiced meats and is a good alternative to metallic macros.

On tap at Munich brewpub. A veiled slightly coppery golden with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, lemon. Flavor is fruits, some spice. Finish is hoppy (herbal and spicy). Lingering fruit. Medium body, soft mouthfeel and average carbonation.
Fad i München. Gyldne dråber med et fast skum. Aromaen og smagen er næsten ens, dvs. sødlig kraftig maltsmag med kun lidt humlebitterhed og med en aroma af malt og græs.

Pues una cerveza que no ofrece ninguna sorpresa. A pesar de no ser de trigo sigue teniendo bastante cuerpo y un gas fino y vivo. Es una buena elección para tapear y beber una cerveza refrescante que no necesitas tener el paladar perfecto para saborearla.

Flasche 0,5l: Helles Gold, ganz leichte Trübung, etwas feinporiger Schaum; in der Nase leichte Süße, malzig, etwas Honig, sehr mild, leicht würzige Noten; im Körper frisch und mild, leichte Süße, malzig, Honig, leichte Würze; milder Nachgang mit leicht würziger Süße

Bottle 0.5
Качественный, приятный хеллес. Отлично пошел с сушеными кальмарами)

On tap at City Pub in Peje/Pec in Kosovo. Ciao Tommie. Pours pale golden, almost yellow but quite bright a bit hazy with a long lasting white head. Nose: a bit flat, some honey notes. Slightly perceivable milky yeast. Mouth: honey, a bit lemony with a central hole and a mineral end. Nice, no flaws, easy but not terrific. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Classic beer. Tasted several times from the tap and the bottle. Also in Munchen! Next one please!
Clear with a straw, yellow colour and thin head. Light malts and grass in the aroma. Quite bland and watery.
Pours clear, nice head. Gold. Aroma is malty, not very intense and not very pleasant. Very sweet, low bitterness and low carbonation.

Aroma: light metallic scent, grain, bread and caramel malts. Appearance: clear gold, massive, frothy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: malty sweets continue, bread and caramel, some cardboard, maybe a touch of citric acid, light bitter and dry finish. Overall: nice Helles, light sweet, very drinkable. Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.
Goldgelbe Farbe , Schaum ok, Geruch hopfig getreidig, Geschmack hopfig leichter Malz Getreide ganz leicht süß, süffig
Vom Fass und aus der Flasche. Goldgelbes Bier mit luftigem weissen Schaum. Getreide und Citrusaromen. Süffiger Geschmack. Ebenfalls leichte Säure. Getreidig im Abgang.

Grainy sweet malt aroma, medium high flowers and herbal hop aroma. Light honey and cracker. Totally bright, deep gold, average white dense foam. Sweety grainy and light bread notes, very low hop flavour, low dms. No diacetyl. Medium high body, not dry. Medium low carbonation. Absent astringency.
On tap. Clear golden, small white head. Aroma is light sweet malts with some light honey, similar taste, watery texture, medium carbonation, light sticky sweetish aftertaste.

Pour from bottle, the liquid is medium bodied and light gold in color. Not very lively and flattens really fast. Smell very lightly alcohol and taste somewhat sweet, but leave a somewhat bitter aftertaste. Overall, it’s ok but really can’t say that I love it.

500ml bottle. Pours a clear pale golden colour with moderate white head. Aroma is slightly sweet and malty, grassy, hops. Same can be said of the flavour.

2015-06-24

bottle 500 mL poured in mug. golden well carbonated beer with medium white head, aroma is malty and a hint of its hops, taste is watery, somewhat balanced but very lightly flavored, refreshing. i think is solid for the style but nothing in special.
Color oro chiaro con consistente schiuma. Aroma erbaceo.Al palato leggero malto e miele . Mediocre.

Uma puro malte de respeito,seguindo a lei de pureza alemã.Cerveja clara dourada,creme pequeno mas consistente e duradouro,no aroma perfume herbáceo do lúpulo,e malte mais discretamente,notas de pão,no sabor uma predominância do dulçor do malte,ótima drinkability,conjunto muito bom.

50 cl can from a random supermarket in Zagreb, served in a snifter. Golden yellow with medium white head that dissipates quickly. Aromas of malt, bread, hops, grass, citrus, fresh. Medium body, light carbonation. Taste is well balanced, with very subtle sweetness, and bitter finish. Very slight astringency develops later on.

Nez: Céréales, citron
Bouche: Céréales, citron, légère astringence
Une pils des plus classiques

Pours crystal clear gold with dense white head. Hoppy bitterness with malt sweetness and a hint of grassiness. Relatively long finish of malt.

Bottle 0,5.
Clear yellow color. Light malty aroma. Salty taste. Easy to drink, refreshing.
Espuma blanquecina que permanece como una fina capa, color amarillo muy claro, burbujeo constante, ligero aroma al lúpulo, sabor suave apreciándose el lúpulo, regusto corto

Not quite sure how I’ve never rated this. Had plenty of times by the bottle, by the stein in Munich. Had a couple of steins the other day at Katzenjammers. Clear gold with thin white head. Aroma is slightly grassy, perhaps a little hay but very little really. Refreshing, not overly carbonated, grass and light hops. So easy to drink.

Served from a ’limited edition’ FC Bayern München can with Jerome Boateng’s face on the back of it. Fairly bitter and malty. Aroma suggests that it’s going to be a bit sweet but it’s more woody than anything else.

Buen aspecto dorada clara mínimamente nebulosa y espuma densa y muy blanca. Apenas aroma, cereal. En boca tiene cuerpo moderado y gas punzante. Y un sabor equilibrado con rica base cereal y un caracter general bien seco, especiado y muy refrescante.

-very floral and slightly metallic upfront

Ubiquitous beer, often sampled in the past. On this occasion it was drunk on draught at a beach bar in Latte, Italy. Clear, golden colour with a refreshing, slightly citrusy taste and big, mineral-tasting hops. A standard Helles, but very reliable and highly enjoyable to drink.
Clear golden yellow color with medium head. Aroma is malt, herbs. Flavor is malt, grain. Not bad basic lager.
50cl bottle. BBE 12/15. Poured clear golden with a thick white head. Quite refreshing, bit thin. Clean malty, slightly citrusy. Some minerals in flavor. Light bitterness. Decent helles.
No special, but it is so good. It is very familiar taste, dark yellow apparence. And palate is little heavy I think.

Ucice 13/8 2015. 50 cl can from local market (Voli). Idyllic skyline of Munich on the can. Pours clear pale yellow with big white head. Settles as thin layer of foam with some lacing. Aroma has fine balance between sweet malts and bitterness. The same goes for the taste that is slightly to the bitter side. Fine well balanced lager.
Draught, smallish head, quite clear yellow color, light malty honey aroma, straw grainy flavor, light malty sweetness. Drinkable but nothing to write home about.

Ein gutes Helles.
Getrunken frisch gezapft im Seehaus/München. 
Im Glas Gold-Gelb mit schöner feinporiger Schaumkrone. 
Im Aroma sehr malzig mit ganz leichten, feinen Hopfenaromen.
Im Geschmack dominiert Brotkrume, etwas Honig und ansonsten leichte Fruchtigkeit, allerdings nur ganz dezent. 
Insgesamt ein erfrischendes Bier mit feinem, aber wässrigem Geschmack.

The beer like ordinary. A pale yellow color and crystal clear. There isn’t much foam. The smell is great. There is a delicious sweetness in the smell, a little fruity and a little malty, quite unique. The taste is also very nice. There is a nice sweet taste, together with some bitterness. The taste is fruity, but also has a unpleasant wood like taste. Get rid of this and you have a perfect beer.
Bought at a gas station in Germany. Bready malty smell. Similar taste with a herbal aroma. Distinct bitterness. Drinkable but one-sided.

At first it seemed that too bitter. But the bitterness of the right, as This beer tasted nothing but "hops, malt and brewer of conscience"))
I was given a tasting card, put its marks for taste, aroma and aftertaste. The bartender told me to compare with other Helyami that is on the menu - one of Bladbahera (Barnaul), another German (do not remember). So, after Paulaner’a they even beer is not very similar, too have "original" flavor.

On tap. Schiuma compatta. Amaro moderato. Intensità olfattiva elevata. Persistenza olfattiva discreta. Frizzantezza determinata da poca carbonazione. Corpo rotondo. Persistenza gustativa sufficiente, comunque buona. Intensità gustativa normale, che si avvicina ad essere elevata. Plus: Verticale. Bottiglie bevute 11/2016. (A 7. A 3. T. 6. P. 3. O. 3.0) Il gusto al naso riconosce l’orzo. L’intensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma ha una discreta resistenza. Le bollicine hanno una grandezza media. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. Le bollicine sono medio-fini. La carbonazione è media. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è rotondo. Il dolce è medio in equilibrio con l’amaro medio. L’intensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è pulito e semplice. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. L’aroma in bocca riporta sentori di pane, biscotto e fieno. Bottiglia BBE 05/2010. Bottle courtesy of Roberta Reganati. (A 6. A 4. T. 6. P. 4. O. 3.0) Il gusto al naso ricorda l’orzo tostato. L’intensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma formata da poche bollicine ha una scarsa tenuta. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. La carbonazione è piatta. Il colore è giallo ambrato. Il corpo è strutturato. L’amaro è medio. L’intensità gustativa è elevata. La persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono lunghe e quasi di amaro. Il finale è setoso e complesso. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. In bocca l’aroma restituisce percezioni di miele, affumicato e torbato.
Bottle. Golden color with intense and thick white head. Malt and grassy hops in aroma. Taste is malty with quite short aftertaste. Flavors of grains, caramel.
0,5 l Flasche. Helles, gelbes Bier, weißer, grobporiger Schaum. Leicht säuerliches Aroma, leicht säuerlicher, leicht süßer Geschmack.

Lightly opalescent sun yellow colour with a light fluffy white medium sized head. Aromas of wheat bread, hay an a light touch of floral hops. Lightly carbonated, lightly smooth texture and a medium body. Malty sweetness is well supported by a subtle light spicy bitterness. Short-medium lasting finish. A thirst quencher.
light sour hoppy aroma,pale, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, fizzy, light sweet bitter finish.
Light Gold. It’s not beer: no flavour, no taste. Just dirty water. Terrible. Never more

Mini-Keg @ RBSG 2015. How have I not rated this? Clear golden pour with a tall white head. Nice sweet bready malts. Slightly grainy with some biscuit and toasted grains. Light floral hops, maybe a touch soapy. Light fruity esters and some grassy hops. Minimal bitterness. A classic.

Little keg shared by Jeremy at the RBSG grand tasting in Portland 

Clear golden with a medium sized white head, good lacing. Aroma of malts, wheat and grains. Taste of honey and grains 
 
Ok
Clear , golden, medium head. Malt and hops in aroma and taste. Decent helles.
Keg. Pours a clear yellow color with a medium white head. A big sweet hay and grainy nose. The flavor is big sweet honey flavor. Light toast. Smooth. Very nice.
Helder geel bier met schuim. Smaak is licht zoet en licht bitter hoppig. Standaard bier, gewoon goed.
5l can (no, I didn’t drink all of it). Fairly clean, malty taste, bready, slightly soapy but also rather crisp. I don’t like this style but this beer is actually quite enjoyable.
Very good beer for almost any occasion. Pleasant smell. Good taste without being super delicious. Small head. Overall a safe choice.

From my backlogg: 

Bottle in London 2014. Golden beer with an white head. Fruity hoppy yeasty and grassy aroma. Fresh hoppy fruity and grassy flavour. Refreshing beer :-)
Tap @ Retro Sports Bar. Clear pale golden, white head. Weak aroma, grass, malt bread. Dry mouthfeel, light body. Taste; Sweet malt, white bread, grass. Finish dry and slightly sour.

This is top shelf in terms German hellbier. Corn flakes, sweet honey, with a calm and fine hop bitterness in the finish. A nice light bier to have any time. No need to seek it out, but if your choice is between this another Helles, than I’d go with this guy.
OK øl fra Paulander, men ikke oppe på samme niveau som andre gode øl fra dette bryggeri.
0.5l bottle. A bit sweet aroma, soft carbonation, medium body, has a sweet and woodish taste, feels soft, light and classy.

Pours clear pale golden with white head.
Aroma is honey, quince, iron filings.
Fresh and light. Long bitter ending with hints of quince pudding.

330ml bottle @ Bavarian Bier Cafe, York St, Sydney. Clear light golden with a small white head. Sweet grainy malts dominate the nose and tongue with a light citrus hop bitterness. Clean lightish bodied palate. Not too sickly sweet. Your average sessionable Helles lager.

DAAID; Can 0,5L. Pours moderate, clear gold and frothy with a moderate lasting and lacing white head. Nose is pale malt and hay, light citric orange and spice. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter with a somewhat lasting finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to avarage.

Bottle. Clear light golden with small white head. Herbal, grass, light wood. Light sweet with light bitterness throughout going into a dry slight woody and vegetal finish. Light to medium bodied with slick dry feel. Decent enough beer.

On tap at Bedford Bamberg Beer Festival 2015. Light to mid-gold, clear with very little head. Lemon-lime aroma, with cereal, grass, hay and a decent dollop of sulphur. Bittersweet taste with a slight sourness. Astringency in the finish. A very decent and tasty lager.

330ml bottle @ BMW Welt, Munich




Clear golden colour with a white head. Malty. Goes ok with a snack.
Piacevole in una giornata calda, leggermente amara. Bionda dall’aspetto limpido, schiuma poco duratura.
Tap in Berlin, 23rd April 15. Not a bad lager, easy to drink in the sun, fairly bitter and some hops to be found
På flaska på stars and stripes. En hygglig tysk vardagsöl, men inte mer. Hade önskat lite mer av en såpass stor producent.
On tap. Clear golden with consistent white frothy head. Aroma malt, grass, hay. Taste is malty, medium body, sour and dry finish. Pleasant bitterness in aftertaste. Above average German lager.
Golden colour with white head. Aroma of hops, maybe some spices, but the flavours are the same: somehow hoppy, with medium carbonation. drinkable, but thats all.
Bottle at home by Eva. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is malty. Taste is medium sweet, malty, bready. Very boring beer.
Bottle. Golden color, with a decent head. Aroma was well balanced with hints of grains. Taste was roasted grains. One of the better German lager.
Pale golden, minimal white head, clear. Grains, cereals, hint of brown sugarand light herbaceous. Carbonated and refreshing, well balanced cereals/grain and bitterness with light sugar sweetness.
Golden color with white head. Grains and grassy malts. Metallic. The finish is unpleasant. A very meh Helles.

On tap at the Paulaner Hofbrauhaus in Munich. Pours brilliantly clear, nice head, bartenders here are careful with fill levels and the foam going to the top of the glass. Clean, easy to drink, perhaps neck and neck with most hell lagers here from the larger breweries.

Pours a crisp clear golden color with a good white head that holds for about 30 seconds before dissipating. Aroma is malt, hay, grass, light caramel, light hops, and a dry sweet fruit at the end. Taste is malt and grass, a very thin body of caramel, and a barely noticeable hop bitter. Overall not bad, very drinkable for a hot summer day, better than the macros from the states.

pours clear yellow colour with a white frothy head and nice lacing.
lots of citrus, hops, paper. light body; sour, but other than that rather bland. dry hoppy finish, little bitterness. would be refreshing on a hot day, i guess..

(bottle 0,5l)

Aroma: Malty, light grainy.

Appearance: Clear, very light yellow color. Medium, white head.

Taste: Medium sweet, malty.

Palate: Medium body. Creamy, oily texture. Dry finish.

Overall: Quite nice, clean, malty helles.
Pale yellow color.Light body and small head.Good carbonation. Distinctive bitterness.
50 cl. bottle. Clear yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, caramel and fruity notes.
Uma lager agradável porém sem maiores atrativos. Dourada, espuma pouca e levemente spicy
Keg in a bar in Geneva as ’Paulaner’. I assume it was this, but may rerate at a later date. Usual standard lager looks. Not much in the way of flavour. Light spice and clean finish. Bland.
Barva zlatá. Pěna držící. Vůně příjemná sladová. chuť vyvážená, výrazné sladovépozadí, hořkost střední, ale dlouze doznívající. Slušné pivo....

Color is so clear it almost looks like water, small foam. And it tastes like water.
0,5 bottle. Clear golden colour, medium white head. Aroma of grass hops, medium sweet taste. Drinkable beer.
Bottle pours a lake golden with a large white head. Aroma of light grassy hops and caramel malt. Caramel malt, with some adjunct corn flavor, and a touch of grassy hops.

500ml bottle at home, from AleselA, Glasgow - cereal is the main component I detect in the aroma, a few streams of bubbles, clear pale straw coloured, thin white head, cereal, floral, poor lacing, fizzy, long malty finish

Pale yellow colour, bitterness in the aftertaste. Not bed but nothing special at all.

bottle @ Jungle Jim’s / Eastgate OH --- Clear golden amber, thin white head cover, dots of lace. Taste is malt with mild hops on the swallow - that’s all there is. Quite agreeable, and refreshing, but not a lot happening.

No foam - dead beer, use to say Dutch beer drinkers. But, maybe just they just not store it properly. Cereal, bread, some metallic, citric also. Clear pale yellow colour. Slightly bitter aftertaste. And slightly average beer.
Décevante. Fort nez de miel, très très fines bulles, pas de mousse. Arrière goût indéfinissable.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear golden colour, medium white head. Lively carbonation. Taste is bitter sweet with hints of fruit. Some bitterness in the aftertaste. Overall nothing to remember, very average beer.
Almost no head, very light Colour. Nose is light and almost saaz’y. Software and pleasant mouthfeel.

Tap @ Edelweiss in Staunton. Served in a mug. Smells like honey nut cheerios and lemon and good bread. Light flavor leaning to the sweet but with a lightly sour (in a good way) under current. Round mouth feel.

Served in a tulip. Dark golden, almost brown with a non persistent white foam. Aroma is citric and bread. Taste is citric and bitter with light maltiness. Bitter and light sour aftertaste. Good beer but tastes more like a Pilsner than a Helles.

Bottle. Poured a light golden color. Low head. Crisp grains and slight hops make for a smooth lager with some nice flavors. Light bodied. One of the better lagers out there.
