This beer was very disappointing especially in its price range.  It poured and had a watery appearence which was consistent with its taste.  Head looked very carbonated.  Not a good one.  The Miller light draft I had earlier in the night at b dub’s was much better than this.
Bottle. Typical malty aroma. Extremely clear with a thin white head.Good carb. Smooth texture, but a bit dull on taste. Delicate bitterness. Pleasant to drink but nothing special.

Slightly sweet malty aroma some DMS from pils malt, noble Spalt, saaz,Haleetaur, Tettnagner aroma...of of the four or two. Grain and malt dominate taste with slight hop bitterness, 16-22 IBU. Malty but not fully attenuated. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Clear golden pour with a thin lasting white head. Aroma is slightly malty and a smooth easy drinking creamy malty flavour.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with little head. Light aroma of hops. Very subtle flavor of hops with a crisp finish. Not a lot of flavor but a nice, very drinkable beer. Definately a beer i wouldn’t mind drinking on a hot summer day.
Draught. Pale golden color with a small but nice white head. Aroma is bready with some hops. A nice clean refreshing flavor with some hops and malts.
Light malty beer with some faint bitter hop, almost skunky. Clean, crisp finish. Drinkable.
Draught. Clear golden color with a thin bubbly white head that left no lace. Light malty caramel aroma with subdued sprucy/skunky hops. Flavor was similar. Crisp and clean finish.
Straw color with a large head that quickly diminishes. Straight-foreward malty-sweet flavor. Light to medium bodied. A great summer beer.
Has a thin body and is incredibly smoothe. This is what a pale lager should taste like. The best word to describe it is crisp.

Bottle. Pours a yellow golden body with a frothy white head and sparse lacing. Sweet cereal and soft delicate hops in the aroma. Flavourwise it’s quite grainy and has a decent sharp bitterness...watery, thin palate that leaves a bit to be desired. Still an above average Premium Lager.

330ml brown bottle. Pale gold colour, good head, white and fluffy. Malt aroma, bready, Malt accented flavour, grassy hop notes in the finish. Mouthfeel is a touch creamy, mild carbonation. Straightforward and clean lager.

Sweet maltly nose, a nice hoppy tone as well, amber, pours a tight finger of white foam, pretty lace. Sweet malt flavour start, good hops bite afterward, with each mouthfull this beer gets better. Medium bodied, very well balanced, lovely bitterness, I could enjoy a few of these.. Great!

Bottle: Poured a golden yellow color lager with a nice medium foamy head with average retention. Aroma of floral malt is light but pleasant. Taste is quite light with some floral malt with some sweetness and a slightly dry finish with low hops. Well done beer with limited complexity but very refreshing.

inoffensive lager. Light malty aroma. Pours a golden yellow, carbonated. Flavour is mostly grassy, a slight cornish finish. Mildly refreshing. Maybe I’ve just moved on from drinking lagers. I have a hard time enjoying them at the best of times, even when they are supposedly above average.
Light golden color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma of bread, malt and some floral hops.  Nice malty flavor without a lot of sweetness.  Very full and soft mouthfeel.  An excellent lager.
The head is big crisp and white. the smell is semi-bitter. taste is that of your every day beer. nothing special.

Tap on Octoberfest restaurant, Athens.
One of the best lagers. Premium indeed. Paulaner really makes good beer for pleasant evenings. Way above average lager with great aftertaste.

From a 1 pt. 9 oz. euro brown bottle with a produced on date in lower right hand corner of front label.

Poured a clear pale yellowish golden with a foamy white head that settled into a thin lacing, very minimal amount of sticking.

Aromas of toasted grains and bready, a light yeastiness and spices, hints of a fruitiness.

Moderate carbonation and a crisp, velvety smooth light-medium bodied mouthfeel.

A nice premium, Helles lager taste, toasty and bready with a touch of dry crackers, spicy, lemony hops, a good soft crispness from the hops, and a dryish malty finish.

Another good lager from Paulaner, tasty and balanced, deserves at a place in your refrigerator.

Bottled version. Made by CCU in Chile under license. Pale golden color. Artificial carbonatation. White and relative slow-collapsing head. Acceptable lacing. Vage hoppy smell. Some skunky and traces. Watery. Weak cereal taste and a very slighty bitterness of hops. A bit sweet aftertaste.

[bottle from SAQ]
Noble hops and malty malt fill the nose in a perfectly balanced crispness.  Crystal bright straw with a fizzy top that doesn’t last long.  The flavour is everything that the aroma promised: modestly sweet malt that tastes like it just came from the farm complimented by a pleasant, spicy hops flavour and gentle bitterness.  My only complaint is a more than detectable taste of ethanol that penetrates the gentle flavour.  Quite a bit of body for such a small beer.  Could use a tad more carbonation too.
Pours pale golden, with white film for head. Sweet malt scent, clean maltyness with a light & cheap hop finish. Simple, boring, mass-produced.

Bottle. Poured clear pale color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate hoppy aroma. Medium body with soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium sweet dry finish of moderate duration.

Pours a clear golden color with small and big bubbles goinf upwards and a thin, bubbly white head. Good aroma of bread crust and crisp malt. The hops are mostly undetectable in the aroma but are more present in the flavor where the noble hops are joined by a good crisp malt and bread crust, there is also some mild citrus. The body is medium and oily while the carbonation is gentle. This a very pleasant and competent lager.

Bottle. Clear, deep straw yellow. Poured a fine tight bead that lasted a reasonable time for a light beer. Earthy spicy Euro hop bouquet quite evident in nose. Low malt as per style. Flavour was the same with a distinct Eur hop spciness. Could have used a bit more malt character to balance the hops, came off just a bit to dryish and thin at the finish, even for a Helles. Good drinking beer on a hot day after a long bike ride.
Bottle: Nicely hoppy a good every-day beer; good specimen of it’s class. Found this one in Costa Rica on a business trip.
Crisp gold colour with a small tight head. Moderate aroma. Clean lightly hopped flavour. A good session beer. Goes well in the heat, and probably the cold. Reminds me of bread with a sweet finish.
Bottle. Clear pale golden colour with a big longlasting white head. Malty grassy with some bready hints. Sweet malty and a little grassy flavor. Sweet malty finish with some bitterness.
very solid mouthfeel, surprised at how thick it felt. Very long lasting head, aroma left little to be desired. not bad tasting, rich flavour. A refreshing drink

Clear golden lager with a spritzy bead and metallic aroma. Insipidly malty and watery with only the vaguest trace of Pils-like bitterness. Possibly very true to the pale Munich style, but could easily be any one of a million interchangeable gassy bland lagers. Tastes like cheap canned lager, out of a bottle. Not one to seek out again.

Light bright golden colour with a light foamy white head.  The aroma is grassy and crisp with a light touch of sugar.  The lightly bitter body contains a semi-sweet malt presence and a crisp leafiness.  Not a bad lager in my opinion, but fairly generic.

Bread and malt aroma and a hint of hops. A solid german lager balanced between sweet and bitter, simple, straight forward with a hint of spice.  Dry finish. Not fantastic but still a good brew for a KC Chiefs pre season game.

Clear golden-yellow body with a short lived white head.  A bit bready with some pilsner-ish hops on the nose.  Taste is bready malt, floury, honey and some faint crisp hops.  The soft carbonation makes it feel even more bland.  By premium lager standard this is probably above average but by beer standard I find it slightly below average.  I usually find the words Premium Lager and Hell to be somewhat synonymous.
This is a lager? Well if so, then it’s an awesome one - very mild, no traces of alcohol, well balanced. Soft fruity notes, so typical of the brewer are also present. Good

12oz bottle. Pale clear golden hue with sparse bubbling. Initially fair white head slowly diminishes to nothingness. Focused pils malt nose plays the note of very fresh breadiness, not without DMS undertones, but they’re perfectly acceptable in that measure. Tart on the palate with soft minty and herbal hops procuring an adequate bitterness while the malt is sweet enough, slightly vegetal and almost fruity. Globally pleasant balance, remaining on the soft side, floral and decently biting malt. Light bodied, soft carbonation nonetheless has a bite. Slightly salty towards the finish, soda crackers like. Authentic, refreshing and straightforward, without the richness of the best example, but smooth enough for a session.

0.5 L bottle.  Drank on 7/11/06.  Very clear light yellow with a big creamy 2" white head.  Drops slowly to a fairly thick layer of foam.  A little lacing.  Aroma - A little sweetness, some bananas.  Little noble hop spice aroma.  Flavor - Sharp and crisp up front.  Pretty well balanced, but still crisp and lagerlike on the tongue.  Some nice subtle german yeast and noble hop character.  Almost a lemony finish as it warms.  Palate - pretty light.  Nice, crisp carbonation, but still smooth.  A tiny bit dry, but not real dry.  Overall - A very nice and easily drinkable lager.  Nice body, very refreshing, and enough character to keep it interesting.

Bottled (BB 04/2007).
Golden color, decent white head. Fruity malty, slightly cardboardish nose. Medium-bodied. Malty, lightly fruity-sweet, grassy hops. Malty aftertaste. Quite boring hell/premium lager.

Nothing terribly special abou this lager except it is very consistent.  Over the years, I’ve never had a bad bottle or can of this brewery’s beer.  This original recipe lager is very tasty, but it doesn’t have much lingering back-taste.  It kinda leaves the mouth quickly.

Bottle 52F Lager Glass.  Light grain aromas of hay and slight just slighty bitter hops. Maybe notes of spicy orange peel, light yeast notes.  Pours a slightly cloudy light golden color,with a nice a decent lasting white head, that leaves a bit of lacing.  Very light taste, just slighty sour with slight barn like notes, and a little hops.  Taste is much light than I had expected.  Mouthfeel is medium with light carbonation. A good smelling and good looking light beer, in the world of light lagers this is good, but just not my favorite style but, this is a good example of one.
Bottle. An amber coloured pour with an average head. Nice floral hop aroma. Taste is hops and citrus. A hoppy finish with moderate bitterness. Another boring lager.

1 Pint, 9 oz. Bottle: Clear gold with no head.  Malty aromas with a light grape accent.  Light flavors of fruit, rapes and yeast.  For a lager, it wasn’t too sweet which was nice.  Lots of carbonation and refreshingly easy to drink.  There really isn’t much flavor in this brew, but it isn’t horrible either.

A good solid choice for those who like Lagers. If you have not had it I would suggest it. A solid, if average, offering. Goes down nice and you have to roll it around the mouth for a second to really sample the hoppy flavors this brew offers. Not too carbonated either, this beer really feels nice in the mouth. One word to describe this beer would have to be, “refreshing”. Serve it ice cold and be prepared to do a little searching with your palette, it will yield a good brew if you take your time with it.

You expect more from anything from "munchen."  it’s a thin, no head lager that resembles a urine sample in appearance but admittedly tastes better.  Not the worst thing to pull out of a fridge at a party but probably shouldn’t show up at yours.
Bottle (from Tesco). Light drinkable lager with subtle hay hops but more focused towards the malt. Not bad but I would have prefered more hop presence to round this off.
malty and lightly spiced aroma.  full malty lager flavor without getting sweet and syrupy.  light clove in flavor.  gold color.

12oz bottle. Clear pure gold color with small white head. Sweet and also grainy malt aroma. Very light tasting beer. The flavors are mild with no off flavors of any kind. Silky smooth maltiness intermingles with noble hop flavor. The finish has a mild lingering hop bitterness. A good refreshing beer.
Golden with a small white head. Leathery, malty aroma. The taste begins slightly metallic, becomes straw, and ends with a pleasant hop burst. This is drinkable.
Bottle. Small head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma is malt and hops. Taste is just a little better than your average lager.

Bottle. Golden body with moderate carbonation and average white foamy head. Nice and well balanced malty/hoppy aroma with bready, herbal, and citrusy notes. Decent taste that is, however, less complex than the aroma. Ends with a good bitter finish.

big white head diminished very fast
middle yellow color
smells malty,a bit sweetish,,some hop smell,some fruity smell
rather carbonated
tasts bitter-sweet,hoppy,malty
aftertaste hoppy,malty,good bitterness,a little bit sweet,some alcohol
not so boring than much  lagers,has more character than others
by the way:nice can8for a collecrionatrice like me!)

500ml bottle. The completely clear head disappears quickly. The aroma lingers scentfull and grassy. Strong matle taste with a surprising attack of hops in the finish. Tingling and sparkling a long while after swallowed.

Bottle. Skunked.  Pours light and golden, with a slight haze.  A clear skunk aroma.  Purchased at a shop warm.  Since this was small town Ohio, I expect that this bottle didn’t lead a good life.  (Date on bottle is only 9/05)  Slight hint of hops in the aroma and the body is medium.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear straw golden color with a fizzy bright white head. Head receedes leaving very light lacing. Nose is straw and light sweetness. Palate is crisp and refreshing. Flavor notes of light straw, some sweet malt notes.
Pale, golden in color with small quickly diminishing head. Aroma is malt, slightly sweet with notes of floral and sourdough bread. Flavor is slightly sweet with floral notes. A good beer indeed.
Bottle. Caramel aroma notes, pale straw colour, somewhat  faint hoppy and minerally background flavour, quite a pleasant lager

Bottle from Tesco. Pale straw coloured lager with a big fluffy white head. Malty aroma with hints of breakfast cereal, wafer biscuit and honey. Prickly carbonation upfront with soft, sweet malt, ice cream wafers, cereal and a slight sharp lemon hop finish. A good quality German lager but not outstanding.

Pint, off tap, at The Clifton, Bristol. Translucently clear green-copper gold colour. Aromas of freshly cut grass, accompanied by vanilla and caramel. Good pils/lager flavour, metallic, perhaps slightly sweet and hoppy. A faint bitter finish. I found this beautifully smooth and refreshing to drink - a fine example of German Lager.
Middle of the road premium lage.  Piured pale gold, quickly dissapating foamy white head.  Smooth flavor, very little hops.  Strong for water, weak for beer.
Pours a yellow color, with aromas of fruit and yeast. Goes down fairly smooth. A bit boring, but nothing wrong with it.

Bottled. I was a little concerned since the 6-pack I bought had some dust on it. It had a very hoppy and malty scent to it. A little too much carbonation in my opinion. Paulaner has grassy hops, fruity aftertaste (possibly citrus or banana). Has a faint bitter finish. Very refreshing and easy to drink with. Paulaner Munich Hell could be my standard German lager! Way better than Beck’s and Warsteiner!

Bottle.
No stand out aroma.
Appearance is a typical premium lager appeal.
Flavor is crisp with a sweet hoppy taste to it and mild bitters.
Goes down smooth and can make you wish for another one.
Clear fizzy yellow color with a medium creamy white head. Sweet grainy aroma and a stale grain and corn flavor

Very clear, golden-yellow body with some bubbles rising from bottom of glass to surface. Head is thick, white, largely-bubbled, and quick to dissipate. Aroma is fresh grass, lager yeast and slight banana ester; soft, but luckily nothing offensive.  Taste is full and strong, carbonated, yet thin bodied on the tongue. Tastes of fruit, malt, yeast, pepper, and a bit of hops. All in all, this is a fine example of a lager, but as its German, its not so suprising. For a macro-brew, this kicks ass. Sampled from a 350ml can, purchased at "Lider Mart" in Arica, Chile.

Gold in colour with medium to high carbonation. Aromas of light malt, some  German noble hop, and a slight touch of sulfur. Pretty much your standard pilsner light malt+hop combo as far as the flavor goes. It could have used a bit more bitterness and hop flavor, and perhaps it lacks a bit of snap on the finish. Overall this is an inoffensive, but well made German lager.

Pours clear golden, with a small white head. Aroma was grainy and a little sour, no hops at all. There is nothing standout about the beer, the palate is dominated by sweeter malts and the finish has some light grassy hops and a slight bitterness. Enjoyable to drink, but nothing fantastic.

Brown bottle, 330 ml, expiry date: 01.07, purchase date: April 21, 2006; eye: straw in color, clear, white head that disappears rapidly, not much effervescence; nose: malt (grain) that dominates everything else; mouth: midly sweet, again malt that dominates, disappears and is replaced by some light bitterness, finale where a hint of sweetness replaces the bitterness, light to medium body, grainy texture, good carbonation

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 330 ml, date de péremption : 01.07, date d’achat : 21 avril 2006; oeil : paille, claire, mousse blanche qui disparaît rapidement, peu effervescente; nez : malt (grain) domine tout le reste; bouche : moyennement sucrée, malt domine, s’efface puis est remplacée par une légère amertume, finale où une pointe de sucré remplace l’amertume, corps léger à moyen, texture granuleuse, bonne carbonatation

Bright yellow gold hue, with an off-white head, toasted pale malt nose, with a hint of straw accent in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a crisp grainy sweet pale malt, bready note, leading towards a soft lingering bitter hops finish.
A pretty decent lager.  Nothing really grabbed me about it, but nothing really detracted from it either.  Preferable to their hefeweissbier, IMO.

Not terrible here, but nothing completely outstanding, either.  Pours a clear light golden into the glass with a medium-diminishing sudsy head.  Complex aromas of sourmash, lemon and hops to the nose.  A light, hoppy flavor predominating through the backend.  Some light malt flavors with small citrus notes.  Refreshingly cleansing to the palate.  All of the components seem to be there, but in individual states.  There just doesn’t seem to be anything drawing the complete package together.
Pale yellow colour with a medium mostly lasting creamy white head. Mild aroma and flavour. Good on a summer day.
Pale gold with a very nice balance and flavor but very little of it, a very light beer actualy not a premium lager at all. Refreshing beer to drink with almost any meal.good carbonation... light body
Fruity flavor, with an OK taste and finish. There was just nothing that really stood out for me with this beer.
Slighty hazy gold with a small white head and a sweet hoppy aroma. malty taste with a tiny bit of bitterness.

This was my favorite lager at Oktoberfest.  Athough the Oktoberfest marzen brews were tops.  This is golden yellow, big foamy white head.   Strong aroma of spicy hops and alcohol.   This goes great with rotesery chicken.  Meant to drink by the litre.

(bottle) Clear and pale golden colour with a foamy and lacy white medium head. Sweet malty aroma with dense notes of grassy hops. Moderately sweet malty, slightly grainy taste, medium to light bodied, crispy mouthfeel; dry malty and herbal and grassy hoppy finish with a nice and present bitterness.
Bottle.  This is a light gold beer with a sweet hoppy aroma. It’s a light bodied drink that goes down easy and has a surprisingly sweet finish. A good
A light golden yellow beer with a light weak head. A floral hop aroma with a sweet finish. A dry hop flavour with the floral notes of the aroma.

Chilean licensed version, ABV: 4.6º Bright golden color with some bubbles. Its head is white, frothy and averagely sized. The lacing is scarce and leaves some pieces of film covering the beer. The aroma is clear but very subtle with perfume notes and some toast insunuations. The alcohol is very noticeable in both the aroma and flavor though the this is overall sweet and nicely bitter at the end. The body is light and somewhat watery (in a nice way) and soft carbonated.

"Poured a nice golden yellow color with a big fluffy creamy head. Nice lacing, aroma was weak Mouthfeel was thin but refreshing. Flavor was good malty balanced with nice hops but not to bitter. Overall good beer."

Bottle: Pours golden with a small white head; grainy, dusty, sweetish nose; sweet-malty slightly bitter flavour, some citrusy traces, medium bodied; sweet, fruity-grainy, slightly bitter finish. A well rounded, tasty Münchener Helles..............

bottle - Moderate, fading head, not bad malty aroma.  This lager has a mildly sweet flavor with a nice hops kick.  It’s smooth and a bit too thin... not a great beer, but a good one, better than many of the lagers out there.
Bottle.  Golden colored pour with a light head.  Light malty taste.  I enjoyed this more than the Salvator.

(Bottle (marked "09.04") from Downeast Beverage Co.) Yellow-gold pour, slightly hazy. Big white head, poor lacing. Nose of sweet hay and rich malt. Mouthfeel smooth, but too watery. Nice slightly sweet, slightly smoky Helles flavor. Good. Not a killer Helles, but I’ll bet this would be great fresh from the keg at a biergarten in Munich.
Bottled.  Delicious aroma of bread and malt.  Clear light golden pour and a lacing, fluffy white head.  Thin body  and sweet malty taste with a liquid dinner roll or two.  It’s a quaffer.
Excellent Lager. This is the way they should all be done. Great yellow colour, and nice head. Every Paulaner I’ve had has been great. (All 5of them)

Bottle, produced April ’05 at 40f. Poured with fine white head leaving some lace. Fine light golden straw color. Aroma of bready malts and light noble hops. Flavor of bready malt as indicated by aroma. Nice and crisp mouthfeel. A fine German lager and one I would purchase again.

What a beautiful beer!  Honey colored with plenty of foam it was a delight to view.  First taste was just a bit on the bitter side but that faded.  It showed a nice balance that got even better as the glass emptied.  It drank like a macro in that it had a very professional feel to it.  It is one that I would purchase again.
NOt really interesting, like a lager or Pilsener, but with that characteristic flavor from GErman beers, with some quallity. It was pale but not clear.

12z bottle, produced on date was 08.05, whatever that means.  Clear golden hue with a finger of quickly dissipating head.  Straw, grass, apples and grapefruit in the nose.  Bready malty nose as well.  Light and crisp in the mouth with a definite bready maltiness as was detected in the aroma.  Sweet malt flavor with a dry hop effervescence.  Still some fruity, citrus hop notes.  Oily and gummy.  But I still like it quite a bit for everyday light drinking.

Much better than the Chilean version. It would be good to do a head-to-head comparison. Maybe next time. The German hop character is clearly noticeable and its overall a much cleaner, crisper lager. There is a soft citrusy hint in the nose and a clear, refreshing taste profile. Very nice.



Rating from 2006. Can from the chilean CCU licensed version (4,6% alcohol): Generic clear golden lager color with an almost inexistent head. Aroma is malty with some hoppy presence, pretty good. Flavor is nothing special with a bittersweet start and a slightly bitter finish with some acid hints in the aftertaste. Oily texture. Not really a great one, maybe the original German is better.

6/2/5/2/10: Score 2.5.
Bottled. Light golden with a dense white head. Malty aroma and flavor, with a light bitter finish. Ok, but nothing more. (051209)

This stuff looked like piss and smelled horrible.  I don’t know if I had a bad bottle but the head clung together in chunks like it was old or moldy.  The beer had a sour taste to it.   I wasn’t very impressed with this stuff and I don’t think I’ll be going out of my way to try more Paulaner brews.
Yellowish color, good foamy head. Light malty aroma. Sweet, malty taste with noticeable hops. Quite balanced, very drinkable. I’d say extremely good lager.

Canned - Pours light golden and effervescent with a thin foamy white head head. Aroma is bready lager yeast with light cracker maltiness and just a hint of herbal Hallertau. Taste is lightly malty and easy to drink. Not a whole lot of a distractions. Very clean fermentation, no flaws. Mouthfeel is somewhere between thin and medium bodied and lively carbonation. Considering that this brew has no adjuncts, it seems heavy when compared to most industrial lagers. Paulaner is traditional quality, and their beers are well-crafted. Their beers set, but rarely exceed the standards of quality within their style. 



Canned in Germany - Pours light golden and clear with a thin, mostly receding white head. Aroma of chewy malt, corn, and bready adjuncts. Taste is lightly sweet, with notes of bready malt. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with lively carbonation. Sweet, chewy, malty, and unclean.

I like these German lager offerings.  Nice, warm, fairly but not overly bitter taste, well balanced all around.  All the same, after growing accustomed to the fine US west coast ales, its quite apparent that time has passed the Europeans by.  Fine for nostalgia’s sake, otherwise stick to the US stalwarts.
Pours out a light gold pour with minimal bubbly head.  Aroma is weak, with minimal hop and malts, some grass.  Flavor doesnt do much, crisp, grassy minimal hop still there.  Mediocre is being nice.

Poured clear gold with a generous foamy head. Typical lager aroma of indescriminate malt and hops. Some bitterness, but generally at an inert balance. Pretty thin, although a nice carbonation level gives it a bit of zing. Seems like a pretty good sessional beer as it’s not really bad, just not very interesting.
(Bottle)  Pours a pale golden body with a moderate white head.  Aroma of straw, florals, and earthiness.  Flavor of malt and mild hops

Clean, sweet, lightly malty aroma with herbal and lightly spicy hops apparent.  Clear golden body is topped by a decent, fine-bubbled white head that recedes to a lasting cover.  Somewhat sweet, malty flavour with moderate bitterness and lightly spicy, grassy hop character.  Crisp, pointy carbonation to the medium-light , very dry body.  Bitterness seems perhaps a bit strong for the style.Lager glass.  Fridge temperature.  Bottle (Produced On 0605, Liquor Mart, Oct-05).

I didnt even realise that paulaner did non-wheat beers. Aroma is lagerish but soem small hints of sweetness in there. Taste is similar though not sure whats actually going on in here soemtimes i get some fruityness and other sips give me nothing.

Golden with a very slight rusty hue. No head, except for tiny lace. Decent nose with hints of honey. Slight alcohol taste that becomes a little maltier as it warms. Kind of a nice faint, floral after taste. Little on the boring side though guess.
(Stockholm Beer Festival 2005) Yellow with a white head. Fruity aroma with some yeast and some hops. Fresh hoppy flavor. Quite nice to be a lager...
Pale golden color.  Light sensitive beer sat too long on the shelf.  This was a good beer nice and cold.  Little hops good strong malt flavor  Still has the old world flavor.  Good Job!!!
A golden coloured beer with a small white head. The aroma is malty, the taste malty and sweet. (Bottle 33cl)

[bottle from peckhams] pours pale yellow with a moderate head. The aroma is lead by grass, herbal hops with some background biscuity malt notes but it all smells a bit stale. decent body with a little bitterness in the finish, but stale again on the palate.

Bottle - September 2005

Pours a golden colour with a decent head that lasts just long enough. Aroma is slightly sweet and malty. Flavour is malty, medium carbonatation, medium bitternes, no aftertaste. Just a fine lager, nothing else.
Very dependable premium lager, that pleases, if not greatly, then at least reliably.  Malt sweetness with a good balance of subtle hoppiness on the bitter backside.  Good.
Bottle.  Pale golden color with a small but nice white head.  Aroma is bready with some hops.  A nice clean refreshing flavor with some hops and malts.  An enjoyable lager.
This beer has a nice color and feels good on the palate.  It does have a small head.  The taste is crisp and refreshing.  Hops, and slightly sweet.  With a good bitter aftertaste.

Served in a dimpled liter stein from draught.  Golden yellow with a rich thick white head.  Typical lager hay aroma.  Body was a bit fuller than usual for a lager without as much carbonated mouth feel.  The flavor was crisp and clean.  A very refreshing beer to be enjoyed with a plate full of German wursts.

Bottle. Golden colour, unstable head. Sparkling. OK maltiness, quite mild flavour. Mild bitterness. Mouthfeel is quite nice for a yellow beer. 4 2 4 3 9



Draught. Good dusty aroma. Clear dark golden colour. Big stable white head, rocky and creamy. Good flavour, very malty. Low bitterness. Slightly dusty. Has a little sourness, but that tastes as if it is from the tap. 6 3 7 3 16

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow-golden colour with a white head. Sourish aroma with notes of yeast and hops at first, but settles for hops as it warms. Don’t really know what to say about the flavour - it’s like your regular lager, only a tad better. Faint apple notes and some metallic as well. Okay!
At Resi’s. Pleasant pint of lager. Dry with plenty of breadiness. Clean tasting. Nice deep gold color.

Nice, I found this in a store I frequent today. They probably got it for the first time yesterday or today. Anyway, 0.5l can. The aroma is malt, dust and lemon, a bit honey maybe, overall, the aroma feels sourish, but it’s nice enough. Poured a big white fluffy head that left scant lacing,  and is golden with lively carbonation. Sour (for a lager)  taste, lemony, with some metal undertones, some ok malt can be felt too, faint bitter aftertaste. Spicey ? Definitely not.  Maybe I’m drinking this a bit too warm, but I doubt that it would impress me cold. Not a bad lager, but I’ve drank better.
Golden colour with a big white head. Malty hay aroma and taste. Medium body and a light dry finish.
pours golden with a decent white head, aroma of malt and citrus, taste was of malt, fruit, and a tad bit of hoppiness, not a bad beer, a decent premium lager.
BOttle.  mIne says munchner Original Hell.  Maybe it is different,  decent hell.  fact hell of a beer.
The aroma is of a corn like malt and a hay like hop. Color is golden and pours a good head. Flavor is grassy and the hops and malts are well balanced and its not too sweet. Overall a good lager.
Yellow beer with a big dense white head. Malty aroma with a faint bitterness. Malty, light sour flavor with hints of some fruit and a mild sweet finish.

Cask at Ship and Mitre, LiverpoolYes a good lager, golden, cold refreshing with a bit of hop bite to it.  Frankly after the night I had had on Kolsch, Westmalle, Liefmans and Erdinger, this was a bit of a let down, but very nice all the same
Cerveza alemana que se bebe facil. De sabor agradable, aunque tampoco es una maravilla.
The smell is sweet and grassy. Foamy head. Weird thick palating. Tastes sweet, not bubbly enough but decent bitterness. I don’t get why this is such a high marker.

Poured hazy golden with a thin white head.  The head had pretty good retention.  Aroma had honey, banana, lemon and flower.  Taste had a Pilsner bitterness on top of the flowery malts.  Not bad overall.
Bottle:  Pale golden color with a frothy white head. Aroma is sweet and grassy. Flavor starts honey sweet with bread and grain then a light grassy bitterness. Clean, crisp, smooth and thin.
A functional lager, fine for a late afternoon summer day. Straw colour, a bit of head that sizzles then fizzles. Easy simple drink, a tad spice

Grassy, straw-like, pilsner malt nose with a cooked vegetable and lemon tea-like quality, not at all appealing; very sweet up front and a lame, noble hop vague bitterness; smooth palate; better than kool-aid.

Bottle:  Aroma is light with hints of sweetness, grass, and hops.  Pours a transparent gold with a small white head that diminishes quickly.  Lightly sweet up front with an even lighter sourness that lasts up to a light hop finish.  Refreshing and easy drinking on a hot day like today , but nothing special.

(Bottle 50 cl) Abroad Paulaner may best be known for it’s range of wheat-beers. But there’s much more to this brewery. Very pale with a lovely, creamy head. Sweet malty presence in both nose and flavour and an almost overwhelming softness. An excellent beer reminding me of some of the best Czech pilseners. 210899

Bottled.  A pale greeny coloured lager.  The aroma is sweet and a bit tinny.  The taste is also sweet and a bit flowery and sickly.  Not really very special.Score 1.9
Subsequent rating scored 2.7. Average becomes 2.3

Bottle into kolsch glass, Edelweiss German Restaurant, Bellevue NE.  Bright clear yellow in the glass with a bright white head.  Sticky, dense lacing with quick but deep sub-surface racing.  Smell of wheat, bread, and noble hops.  Light malt flavor, softly sugary like powdered sugar.  Hoppy finish as advertised, with musty malt and prickly hop acidity, almost dry.  Smooth and drinkable, light and subtle, this was enjoyable overall.

This was from a bottle. It poured a sparkling golden liquid with a one inch rocky white head that dissipated quickly leaving nice lacing on the glass. The aromas were subtle but primarily malt with some notes of grass and earth. The mouthfeel was a little watery and the flavor was of malt balanced nicely with just a bit of hop bitterness. The finish was a bit thin and disappeared too soon.
draft, yellow golden color w/ small head.  pretty ordinary, taste like lager.  another pale lager.

Tasted from the bottle and expecting a lot as it was advertised as a Völlbier (full). Pours a brilliant pale gold with a short soapy white head. Sweet honey and grainy malt aroma with a background of grassy hops. Sweet palate, very light bodied and medium in carbonation. Flavours of grain husks, light honey front and a grassy bitter side, made for a sessionable but not ’braggable’ bog standard Lager. Knowing the history of this brewery, I did expect more.

A bit of a disappointment in that all of my beer sampling perceptions pulled in very little to judge by.  Looked good, gold with a tall white head.  Very faint malt aroma.  Very faint malt tastes atop a super-soft mouthfeel.  Little hopping.  VERY clean finish.  So and so.
About as middle of the road as you can get. No off flavors, just, y’know, beer.  Yellow, big white head. Notes of corn chips in the aroma and taste.
On tap, nice palate, refreshing pils but not a lot of interest going on and hops were less prominent than I’d have expected.

Bottle. A big bold head that came racing out of the bottle full of fluff, which started the pulse racing. Sadly, the nose was of wet dog hair (which later softened to a ripish malt, but still an oddity there). Palate was rather short (all front and mid) for this style. Not a big beer, still drinkable though not great.

Bottle. Straw colored with a small, dazzling white snowdrift of foam. Head has decent staying power and leaves sparse, spotty lacing.  Malty nose with a sulfur edge is supported by mild scents of honey, flower garden, wet sycamore tree, hot crusty bread, and glazed carrots. Allowing the beer to warm reveals the musky, nutty perfume of barley mash. Flavor: lackluster, lemonlike tart sweetness leads to mineral water, then bread and butter. Barest noble hop spiciness in the aftertaste. Thin and slippery in the mouth. Once it hit my lips, the beer was a total letdown.

Pale straw coloring with no head. Doesn’t have a strong aroma just faint honey scent. A full crisp flavor with hints of clove. It rests in the center of the palate and finishes with an almost metallic bite.

(Bottled@Õlletorn, Tallinn) Pale golden color with a small head. Honey-fruity aroma of cooked vegetables. Lightly malty, sweetish flavor with a metallic finish. Quite light-bodied, carbonated palate with not much going on. A reasonably refreshing, but quite dull brew.
easy lager, head dissapears quickly, well .....the whole beer also dissapeared very quickly from the mug .. easy drinking and quite good, but lacks filling
This is a well mannered lager that sits well on the palate.  Head is thin white and dissipates quickly.  This is a very inoffensive beer that can be quite enjoyable after a long day of work.
A guzzler.  Very refreshing on a hot summer day if you want real beer, not fizzy beer flavored water.  Great for style, perhaps a guilty pleasure?
Clear golden, large white head. A little bready, malty, and with some leafy hops. Crisp and refreshing, lighter bodied. Pretty nice.
A very hearty and satisfying brew.  The only thing missing is the Oompa band and the hot German chics in short skirts.

Bottle. Crystal clear yellow beer with a thin white head. Persistent ring wit minimal lacing. Grainy sweet aroma with a noticeable grassiness. Tastes lightly bready sweet with a light and spritzy mouthfeel that finishes dry and slightly spicy. I think subtle is the key word here, not too much to think about. Clean, light, and refreshing. Goes down with a quickness.

Bottled:
Malty, light grainy nose. Golden color, foamy head. Grainy malt flavor, straw, few hops. Weak and boring.

Draught, Paulaner Beer Garden, BangkokClear golden with thin head. Aroma of buttery biscuits, earthy hops.  Clean palate with slightly crisp hops backing up simple bready pale malts.  Finish is moderate in both length and sweetness.

Bottle.   Wheat malt aroma - a bit of corn as well.  Yellow color with moderate head.  Light malt flavor - nothing distinctive with good carbonation.  Paulaner makes good, reliable beers - this isn’t spectacular but is very nice.  One of the better German lagers.
Truly good. Dense and persistent. Intense round and bitter body. Fresh and rich of scents.
Good body.  Slightly sour aftertaste.  Well balanced.  Not bad, but nothing terrific.

This one came out of a bottle.  pours a standard light gold/straw color with a fluffy white head.  Aroma of noble hops and a hint of malt.  Has the light "candy" sweetness of lager malt cleaned up by a mild, well balanced bitterness.  Medium body with light carbonation.  Nothing too complex here, but an all around solid lager.

Draught at the Alexander Hotel, Derby. As DeepBlack said before serving, "it’s not bad for a lager". Looked OK, good deep straw body with controlled head, whiff of maltiness in the nose, dry and cold finish that wasn’t particularly inspiring; of course I’ve had worse (jeez, I’ve had B*d) but I’ve had better mass product than this.

I think I had a bottle that hadn’t travelled too well - smelt very strongly of baked beans/tomatoes.  Very elegant looking - straw color,  although little head retention.  Palate was light although slightly stale - I don’t know how old the bottle was. Was dissappointed as I tried this after reading many good reviews. I may try it again from another stockist.

In the bottle. A very pleasant lager. Pale golden color with a fine arousing head of white frothy bubbles. Great lacing down the glass as the beer is consumed. The aroma of mown hay takes me back to Munchen and the great time I had drinking this stuff at Die Wiesen. While one should only have a beer like this von fass, the bottle will have to do for home use.

Bottle. Aroma of sweet hops and a little banana. Color was goldish. Flavor is weak and tasts slightly like banana, somewhat similar to a weizen. Carbonation was disappointingly weak, if at all. Disappointed overall. Not a repeat buy.

Rerate.  This bottle had more skunkyness in the aroma, and the palate was uninspiring.  Deep gold in color, with aroma of hopcit, slight honey, and a taset of malty subdued sweetness combined with hopcit and a finishing smooth honeyishness.

Hoppy aroma, floral, with mild bitter astringency. Golden yellow clear with thin white lacing head. Medium light body with medium carbonation. Starts with medium acidity, hoppy resins, papery stale, with light malt. Medium dry hoppy finish, with no harsh bitterness. Decent malt though not overly sweet. A pretty good balance for a lager.
Pale goldne colour. Frothy, medium head. Malty, bready aroma. Tastes bready, slightly sweet and malty with  a hint of sourness. Good mouthfeel. A bit too boring to excite me.
Pours a nice medium golden color. Aroma is grainy and a little sour. Flavor is a little malty and grainy. Also a little metallic. Nothing special. Decent lager.
Ham ’n eggs in a bottle.  (Maybe it sat on the shelf too long, though it was plucked from a refrigerator.)  Certainly better on all fronts than a typical American lager, though.

Draft at Capital Ale House Innsbrook. Golden body with a small white head. Nose is malty and bready with light grain aromas. Taste is malt with stronger bread notes and some mild hop and grassiness. Body is medium and well carbonated. Finishes with more malt, sourdough bread, and with mild grass notes.
Fragrant floral and fruity aroma with a malty nose.  Gold with a small white head that totally dissipates.  Buttery and mildly bitter flavor, a bit fruity.  Bold and refreshing palate.

duvel tulip glass, very hot and spicy foods: a lager! crisp delicious! oh wait... this is a bit thick and cremey for a lager. some banana notes as well. hmm. refreshing. i must rate on a clean palate. thus the rating is for now: strong!

17 July 2004 - Sweet wheat and citrus and aroma.  Clear yellow golden colour with a reasonable white head, with suds lacing and ordinary head retention. Ordinary sweet wheat flavour.  Dry lingering crisp hop finish that is a bit ordinary. In a word ’plain’.
Spicy fruity malt aroma. Clear yellow colour with small head. Uninspiring sweet flavour. Flat palate.
Golden colored with big bubbled foam. Mild caramel aroma. Flavor starts with light malts, ends herbal hops giving nice bite in tongue. No carbonation at all, it isn’t needed either.

golden yellow with a medium head and good lacing.
easy malty aroma with a slight whaty tangy taste not bad but average.
Yellow with thin head...smells a little grassy but more malty than I expected...generic lager taste unfortunately...

A fine beer and I must say it has made me want to try other beers from this company. Just a clean crisp lager but with rich flavor. It taste like traditinal "Beer" but it is worlds away of what some Americans think a lager should taste like. Refreshing
Bottle.  Yellow color with a foamy white head.  Much smoother than I expected with an unoffensive aroma.  Best in show of the flight of lagers recently.
A yellow beer with a small disappearing head. The aroma is malty with notes of straw. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of straw.
Golden color, large white head. Nose is soft malt and a trace of hops. Smooth, softly carbonated, clean and light. Good balanced flavor. Not bad but this is just another German Lager among many.
Light cloudy, with pale yellow head.Vegetal banana with dry oat aromas.Banana, light mid length finish. SOme light hops. Ok Session beer.

Pours a clear golden color with a thick, creamy head. Aroma is malty with a touch of hops. Mouthfeel is smooth, silky. Flavor is a well-balanced maltiness with a hop undercurrent. Very nice, drinkable.
[Draught] Slightly fruity aroma and flavour. Otherwise malty and sweet. Soft mouthfeel.
typical german lager, not much to say, it’s well made and stands up to being drunk at room temp, other than that, there’s not much to distinguish it from many euro lagers.
Looked golden oragne with a weak head. Has a sweet floral smell. Some spice, some fruit, most notetably a hint of banana. I don’t know what the flavor is exactly, but a good beer.

Side-by-side with the St. Arnold Summer Pils, and it seemed more noticeably Germanic in its ingredients (logically, although the St. Arnold’s claims German hops, etc. etc.)  Dry hop flavors, more grassy.  Some orange flavor, such as might be had in an aspartame-based gum.  Same color as the St. Arnold’s, more bitterness in the finish, and definitely drier. (on tap, Flying Saucer, Addison, TX)

On-tap. Served in Paulaner stein.

Full golden color. Pleasant hoppy aroma. Firm, hoppy taste. Harmonic and highly drinkable.
White medium lasting head. Golden color. Aroma is hoppy with herbal and grainy notes. Flavor is moderately hoppy with cereal and hay tones, ending in a bitter finish. Light bodied.
Poured a deep gold with a large white head.  Bread, floral hop aroma.  Taste was malty - honeyish and slightly fruit - with subdued hoppy finish.  pretty good.

The beer came in a standard 500 ml bottle made with the typical Teutonic obsession about similar color scheme, label style, fonts, and overall look of the bottle to other beers from the same brewery.  The beer poured very pale golden yellow in color with a short (3/4 inch) fizzy head that dissipated quickly.  The beer left very little lacing on the Pilsner glass it occupied.  The nose was malt dominated with honey, sourdough bread, and a bit of graininess.  There was a touch of grassy hops.  The taste was just as advertised by the aroma, with mostly a grainy, sweet character, and a light dose of fruitiness (bananas and apples mostly), and a lemony sourness.  The hops showed up as a spicy finish with a peppery prickliness to them.  The aftertaste was just a tad bit dry, urging you to gulp down the beer faster.  This is a great summertime brew with enough character to keep from things getting boring.

Bottle. Pale golden color with a big white head. Slight grassy-spicey aroma. Flavors are subdued - a little malt, a light bitterness, with an ending of a light fruit (apricot). But it’s easy to drink and has a clean dry finish. There’s more to it than most lagers.

Although somewhat soapy and metallic, this brew is a refreshing bev as opposed to the American standards I had of late been drinking. I reached in the fridge one day, grabbed my last Paulaner, and was relieved to find solace in its loving tongue-fondling, the humble bubbles toppling over my tongue and seeming almost like sensual porn in my mouth...time to end the review.

Sampled draught at Dansk Ølfestival.

Pale golden. MAlt aroma. Sweet with notes of sour dough. Dense mouthfeel. Sadly the flavours are dull and th ebeer gives a massproduced, industrial impression.
Golden color with a white head. Malty with slight metallic hoppy notes. Watery and boring.

A run-of-the-mill beer, Paulaner’s lager is not that good, but not that horrible.  It has a somewhat soapy, metallic taste, with an even more displeasing, soapy aftertaste.  This beer leaves your tongue and palate oily and looking for more.  Not that great of an experience, but it didn’t ruin my night either.  Hmph.  That’s the only way to describe it.  An inquisitive hmph, with shrugging shoulders and a slight look of disdain on the face.  Hmph.

Bottled.  This one had very little going for it in the appearance and aroma department, other than a lot of nice carbonation bubbles.  The flavor was somewhat spicy and interesting, but this is otherwise a very forgettable beer.

Tettnanger hops! It’s gotta be Tettnanger as I had just finished up brewing a kölsch with a huge dump of tett in there and then I popped the top on my can (yes, I bought a case of cans of this) of Munchner and got that very same hop aroma. In cans this is wonderful stuff. I think most lagers ought to be distributed in cans unless the brewery is local. This is what lagers are all about, of course it has a light and delicate aroma and taste, of course it’s thirst quenching. There are no off or adjunct flavors in this one.
Thin, watery body. A bit sweet. Lacking character. even when sampled at the Ausschank am Nockherberg.

Both bottled and on tap. White head, medium existing, hay-yellow body colour, clear. Light aroma, weak hop and malt fragrances. Unexciting flavor, light mouthfeel, poor taste. A boring lager from Germany... God, please let go hop and malt, you must save german macrobrewery befare disaster!

Light malt aroma.  Golden yellow color with a light white head and a noticeable effervesence.  Lightly malty flavor with a noble hop finish that is crisp.  Body is medium for a light lager, with appropriate carbonation and a very refreshing finish.  Overall, this beer is greater than the sum of its parts.

Pours a good solid shade of "beer" with a large white head that expresses the vainglorious nature of true german pilsener. This represents the first decent German beer that I have had in a month, of which two weeks were spent actually traveling in Germany. Strange. Anyway, tastes great, smooth mohtfeel belies its animated guise! I like this one! Good stuff.

[bottle] Pale yellow body and thin, lasting white head. Unremarkable lager aroma (lightly sweet, malty). Pleasant mouthfeel and taste, smooth malt character, with a bitter finish. Hints of bread linger in the aftertaste. A nice, though very simple, lager. Not my favorite.

I am not a big fan of lagers though I have enjoyed several Paulaner products.+++  Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer pours a golden color with a medium sized tan head. Nice clarity. Smells like your typical macro beer. Tastes like your typical macro beer. Unimpressive, but at least not skunky. Sadly, I tried this one on tap a few weeks ago and found it pleasant. The bottle was a real disappointment.

A very good thirst quencher lager, although it is a little bit plain. Generic light maltiness, but a pretty decent hoppy dryness in the finsh. I thought the aroma was slightly skunked, or maybe it just had a "harshness" to it.

Clear with big head. Smells a little malty but very light smell. Light bodied malt and hops balance, quick off the tongue and no lingering flavours. Nothing to it which would make me remember it. Probably the budwieser of Germany.
Clear with big head. Smells a little malty but very light smell. Light bodied malt and hops balance, quick off the tongue and no lingering flavours. Nothing to it which would make me remember it.

Pours a very light, clear yellow. Builds a thick, frothy head that eventually disippates. The aroma and flavor are both moderately hoppy, but well-balanced. Palate is as thin as the appearance would suggest, but the carbonation is dense and lively, making up for the thinness a bit. Very smooth and easy-drinking, if a bit mild compared to some of the ales you can find. A very good basic lager, much better than your typical example.

bottle-clear yellow appearance with veyr aggressive big bubble carbonation.  nice rocky white head.  body is somewhat thin, but doesnt detract from the flavors.  I like this brew and think its under-rated.  maybe im becoming a lagerhead :P
Nice and light colored. A small white head that tends to stay in the glass. Slightly sweet with some citrus notes. A little sweet for my taste, but would be good for a few.

Crystal clear, light yellow lager with a large frothy, white head which diminishes to a small, everlasting, creamy, white head. Good, sparse lacework. The aroma holds floral and butterscotch notes. Perfect balance of light malt and light hops. Not quite medium-bodied with a silky mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Short, very lightly sweet, dry finish.
Clear gold with white head.Some sweetness to the aroma. Light malt sweetness with some citrus in the taste.

I was hit with a huge whiff of DMS upon adding this brew to a glass, which only abated slightly throughout the drink.  Mouthfeel was slightly slick and pleasantly spritzy.  Taste was a mix of cream corn and slight maltiness, with a nice drying bitterness which tailed a bit in the throat.  The color was a typical pale gold as found in other similar beers.  I would buy again if put to it.
Outstanding lager with a hint of spice to it.  Doesn't finish dry at all and goes down very smooth.  had mine in a .5 L bottle.  light hoppiness and very good beer with sausage and saurkraut.

can on the train from munich to innsbrook:  cant tell you about the color but im sure its clear and golden-yellow.  bready malt aromas with medium bodied palate, soft malty character and tangy hop finish. nice. makes train rides very enjoyable. this is one of my favorite in this style. Prost!

I'm not a big pils/lager fan but this isn't too bad. I prefer it to the normal Japanese macro's that I've already grown tired of but I'd rather have their Oktoberfest. Worth a try for all and I'm sure it will appeal to those that prefer crisp lagers.

I've never been a huge fan of lager (except pilsner).  The beer has a faint yeasty smell, and a white creamy head that diminishes into lace.  It is clear, pale yellow in color with a faint flavor of hops, yeast and very faint wheat.  Needs more body.

clear golden, thick frothy bubbly white head, good carbonation, lots of tiny bubbles. the nose is very sweet and alcohol is present with some hops. Medium body with lots of (I wanna say yeast or wheats?!) and just a dab of hops. Qute watery and light.

Beer pours (in Chimay glass) a clear, watered down piss-yellow liquid with a small amount of virgin white head that dissipates quickly to nothing.  Aroma is of - now here's something - a used up urinal cake with faint straw, grass, vegetal tendencies.  Flavor is of watered down straw, grass, vegetal, even soapy.  Not all that offensive, but definitely a disgusting, crappy yellow beer that resembles a weak lager filtered through a urinal cake.  Sampled at 67 degrees Fahrenheit.
Poured with 75% head, a classic lager look.  Sweet malty aroma, almost sugary.  Solid sweet malt flavors in a silky smooth beer.  Ah ... I need a pretzel.

I find it hard to differentiate between Helles' and this beer is no exception. Really clear, good white head. Nicely malty with a bit of herbal hop aroma and spicy hop flavour. Same as any good Helles really but a good beer's a good beer.

Bottle pours a clear yellow color with a nice head and leaves some spotty lace.  The aroma is citrus hop.  The flavor is subtle and a touch lemony.  The palate is, well, like a lager.  Overall, not a bad lager, I guess.
Smells and looks like a typical German lager but tastes a bit better than most. It doesn't have that typical skunky flavor that a lot of German beers have. I'd definitely drink this again.

Aroma had a nice bit of hops, a little bit of lemon, a touch of malt and maybe some wheat? Looks just like any lager I have seen, clear yellow. Tasted lightly spicey hop with a hint of citrus with a hint of malt. Wish Australian lagers tasted like this!

Crystal clear golden colour with an almost orange tint. Medium sized dense white head tops the beer nicely. Aroma of malt, canned corn, a bit of citrus and some yeast. Light-bodied; Some stale malts, bad citrus qualities and offensive metallic twangs are noticeable. Aftertaste is very bland and doesn't show much at all. Overall, not a great beer, and I wouldn't reccomend this one. I bought this twelve ounce bottle at Beers of the World in Rochester, New York and sampled it on 03-November-2003.

Light golden color with a medium-sized white head. The aroma was peppery and spicy with a clean hops character. The flavor was pepery as well with some nice malty sweet tones in the aftertaste. Very crisp, clean feel...semi-dry finish.

for a lager this is a real nice looking beer clear golden colour with a small but persistant white head..good carbonation strings..this is how a lager SHOULD look!
Smell is not to bad..pleasant malts some hops a little astringenmt..fresh mowed grass..lemon..comes to mind.
A real fresh tatseing lager..fairly zings the taste buds..again sweetish malts followed by a lemon-grass flavour..not any bitterness at all.
Good on the tongue as expected no bitterness..good.
A very very drinkable lager..i rate this along with Ayinger's Jahrhundert bier as great lagers!!
Golden color with medium large head. Wheat aroma with some malt notes coming through.Flavor is plain with malt about the only highlight. Smooth and a touch of bitterness on the finish.
Bottled. Tasted, poured, smelled, and looked just like any other German beer.
Flat looking lager with a hopped/wheat beerish flavour and subtle aroma.  Overall a plain lager.

Starts out with your usual quirks that yuo expect in a lager, golden apperance, frothy soda head, but the taste is a little better than expected in this one.  Has some nice subtleties, perhaps some vanilla and cinnamon spiciness, with some citrusy sharpness in the finish.  Pretty one-sided but also balanced.
Expected appearance with nice head. Aroma is lightly malty. Flavor is also lightly malty, very clean, no sulfur of skunk (which is usually what I look for). Tis not bad! ARRR.
THis lager pours a yellow gold color with small lasting head.  Sharp spicy aroma, some hops, some malts.  More spice and malt in the flavor, with a slightly bitter finish. Not a bad lager.

Well it is pretty good for a lager, anyway.  Aroma is hoppy/spicy and to my nose a bit purfumy.  Appearance is typical lager, golden, though this lager does retain a little head and has some very light lacing.  Flavor is little spicy, with a dash of malt, pretty tasty for the style.  Be glad to drink more.
Good, but not great. Another Euro lager with the requisite hop aroma, pale body and reasonable hop/malt balance.
[Note:  Originally I had this under the wrong beer]  One of my favorite beers, on par with Spaten.  Nice and smooth.  You'll love it.
I haven't had a larger in a looooong time and this one hit the spot.  It's an above average larger and good for a hot day.

From the abyss of a much-needed ratings drought comes this above-average, malty lager by Paulaner.  Blond body, with a thin white head.  Crisp, fruity aroma.  Flavor is fruity/malty with a touch of earthy hops.  Certainly better than most American lagers.

Pale yellow body with few bubbles, small white head.  Light malty aroma.  Flavor is not that big, as I would expect from a lager, but it has a nice touch of grassy hops.  Again, I'm not a lager fan, but this was pretty good.

Medium gold color, the head was moderate and it had a nice malty and floral aroma. This was a very tasty beer with good lacing, malty and hop spicy, well balanced and with a smooth finish, a little bitter. Well done!

Pale straw-yellow  and quick-fading sudsy white head. Fragrant German hops, light malts, and yeast, which together form that quintessential musky lager smell. Clean, hoppy taste and perfumy finish. Well-rounded and very good as far as lagers go. A nice casual beer that pairs well with a casual meal.
Not bad beer seemed a bit light and not much lacing from a good head  agree with the taste of dry hops but wasn`t overpowering good bitterness-ENJOYABLE.
Super beer from Munich, not the greatest prices but on tap its paradise, I feel bad for the bottle only drinkers of this great beer.

Color is a golden light yellow with a very foamy, white head that was three fingers high, very tall indeed. Has some big bubbles here and there but is mostly foamy and left small patches of white webby lace. Has a faint but definate aroma of spicy, floral hops and has a small hint of malt sweetness. Taste echoes the smell with a nice sweet malt and ha a very good dry hoppiness that is balanced in quite well. It has a light bodied feel, teetering on the medium side with smooth sweet lightness that finishes with a spicy hop dryness throughout. Good stuff, very drinkable, a perfect lager for some serious drinkin'.
(bottle):  Clear bright yellow body with large off-white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, floral, lemon.  Taste is sweet, almost cloying, floral, finishes a bit lemon.  Light body.

Man Paulaner is good beer.
Hearty, spicy, full flavored beer that fills the mouth and satisfies the stomach.
Nice golden color.  Good hops flavor for such a light beer.  A good choice for a hot day.

When poured into my glass, this beer had a medium sized white head with fine-small bubbles. There was fair lacing on the sides of my glass. This beer had fizzy carbonation along with a yellow colored body. It had a sweet taste to it along with a bitter taste that lingered throughout my rating of this beer but it was not an overpowering bitterness.

This brew pours a large head of fine to large sized white bubbles that mostly diminishes with time and a transparent softly carbonated light yellow orange body.  It has a soft hop aroma with a hint of sweet honey.  Initially, the flavor is smooth with lightly tingling mild hop notes and is very subtly spiced like the description says.  Overall, it is a fine beer with a good palate.

Bright light crystal clear golden color. Initial milk colored head that fades quite quickly. Clean malt with a hint of herbal hops. Light malt sweetness with a near lemon citric, palate clearing finish.  Very clean.
Not bad at all. Nice flavor even though a tad light. Had ample carbonation. Poured nice head which dissapeared rapidly but left a nice lacing.

(bottle) I had a friend drinking a Coors Light at the same time as this and I said this beer is what the Coors Light should try to be. This is a pretty light beer but it is nice to drink. I wish American Lagers were more like this.

Yellow/golden color. Faint grassy aroma with some hoppy smell.  Had some muted sharp notes as it went in, and then a pleasant hops taste is detected along with a small amount of malt that really hits the palatte and sits on it for a good few moments before dissipating.  Not sweet, and although being to light for my taste, though it still is a medium bodied beer, it certainly is a well made beer, that does what it aims to do.

(bottled) Grainy malt aroma with very subtle noble hops, attractive golden color with crystal clarity & a nice creamy white head.  Sweet lead-off is balanced with a gentle bitterness but finishes malty.  Medium body with moderate carbonation makes for easy consumption. Amazingly clean without tasting "sterile".  Truly world class and from the source.
Dark blond color, grassy aroma.  Slightly thick mouthfeel (for the style).  Sweet and moderately hopped.  Decent brew.
I put this in the same category as becks and warstiener, decent mouth feel could be a little more bitter
Nice full lager with a good head.  Nice golden color.  Somewhat sweet but a good full flavor.  Nice happy mouthfeel.  A very nice beer.

Excellent lager.  Frothy pour with a thick head with a fair amount of lacing.  Clean golden appearance.  Scent of honey in the aroma. Excellent mouthfeel - very refreshing after mowing the yard.   Sweet flavor - good balance of hops and malt.

2004-05-15, bottle, 2-2-2-2-5=13
Pale blond color. Light honeyish aroma. Watery and rather dry taste, un-interesting.

2003-04-04, draught, 5-2-4-3-10=24
Blond color. Light aroma, some honey, corn. Some residual sweetness, but too poor malt and hop.
Straw color with a large head that quickly diminishes. Crisp, clean, and very drinkable. Refreshing. Light malt and hop taste.  Finish slightly dry.

Man, this was a tasty German brew. An oat & straw malty aroma that reminded me of alt. This beer looked about as good as a lager can -- intense light gold, very classy graphics, label and logo. Sweet, moderate hopping but well-balanced.  Some sunflower seed tones.  Good mouthfeel, maybe a little clingy.
Bright golden color. Thin but lingering head. Fruity, malty, slightly hoppy nose. Straight-foreward malty-sweet flavor. Light to medium bodied. A great summer beer.
Golden yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet and slightly hoppy. Light flavor with a touch of hops. The finish is a little dry and bitter. This would be a good beer on a hot summer day.

Light pour with a pleasent spicy aroma.  This was very smooth throughout the drink, and had a nice carbonation level without disturbing the roof of my mouth.  Tastes were pretty light, and slightly citrus, but the primary positive quality of this lager was just how smooth it really was.
Pretty good beer.  Pours medium head, which goes away pretty quickly, nice flavor and mild hoppy finish.

Let me start by saying I expected a lot more from this beer. The head was decent and the appearance was good. It went down smooth but the after taste was just average. A good beer but better choices at this price.

Aroma kind of skunky mixed with Hallertauer hops.  Straw-colored, tightly beaded white head.  Not much flavor when it hits my tongue, some light hops.  Well-balanced overall with a bitter, dry finish.

THis is a nice, crisp, clean lager. Enjoyable and very easy drinking. Seems a good beer to place between heavier or spicier beers to give the palate a rest/recoop period. Nice, but not extraordinary in my book.

The beer pours a clear, golden yellow color with a small white head. The aroma is malty and hay-like. Medium bodied, with a nicely sweet, malty flavor and a long sweet finish. This is very smooth and quite tasty. It does come across as a little watery at times, but it is still drinkable.
A good Munich lager.  I like good German lagers as everyday beers.  This one is a bit buttery at times, but it has a chewy character and a nice hop finish.
Well not bad. Pours in golden in color with a nice white head. Decent head retention. sweet malty taste. slight bitter finish
Lightly sweet, with a honey flavor and bready malts. Balanced by some grassy, mildly bitter hop flavors.
Light malty aroma, hints of spices and flaked barley.  Very clean.  Classic example of the style though.

AKA Paulaner Original Munchner Hell. May be Bavaria's #1 beer and Paulaner's #1 Export, but as is true with Budweiser, what the masses like isn't necessarily good. This is your basic Helles lager. Re-rate: Had a draught version at the Paulaner Brauhaus in St. Petersburg, Russia and had higher ratings across the board: 6-5-7-5-13. The low original ratings may be more accurate as they were made during a trip to Germany after being able to compare the Munich Lager to other German offerings.
Great beer! enjoyed it on tap with a fine steak dinner. Excellent color (yellow / Golden) Very crisp and clean taste. Smooth texture. I highly recommend this one

A solid lager, sunny yellow gold, white frothy head recedes fairly quickly. Malt and hops comes through in the nose. Nice hop spiciness all the way through. Subtle metallic undertones. Clean finish although slightly bitter. Fairly Gulpable.

Light gold color. Medium head. Aroma is lightly malty. Aroma is lightly malty. A crisp clean Euro-lager. Malts and hops are mild. Not a lot of flavor. Very drinkable beer, but nothing noteworthy. Mouthfeel is round. Finish is VERY clean. Aftertaste is very slightly bitter.
Very light.  A little caramelized hoarhound note, just like many other German beers.
This is one of the best beers so far that I''ve tried. Nice head, lace all throughout in glass as empties, flavor of banana and nice semi dry hoppy finish.

Had this beer at the Goldenes Lamm in Lindau, Bavaria back in July.  It was like I had died and gone to heaven.  A beer that was not dry, not too sweet a touch of hops that died quickly and went down easy.  Really the easiest most pleasurable beer I ever drank.  It is ashamed that we in the states don't drink more Helles instead of pilsners.  I really liked it.  If my wife liked it, then you know it must be good.
Strong hop aroma. Nice balance of malt & hops in the flavour. Mildly bitter finish. Not too bad but I should have had something better for #250
Bottled(330ml). -true german lager, gold colored, good hoppy finish.........
Head goes quickly, little malt flavours, boring.............................
Poured a pale straw colour with a quickly diminishing head.Fairly sweet with some evidence of hops for good measure. Ok session beer

This beer poured a straw color and formed an bubbly white head that didn''t hold and formed little lace. A strong aroma of bread/grain and slightly of hops. A flavor of bread/grain and some hops. The finish was astrigent. Not the best that this fine company offers.

Here is a lager that just yellls, "Drink me!". Its not a powerhouse, yet its not too light in body. Pours out to the typical golden color of the style with a decent, yet light aroma of hops. Taste is somewhat sweet with a slight detection of nutmeg and cloves. A very drinkable beer that could lead to many more due to how easy it goes down.
Light gold in color.  Nicely rounded malt flavors.  Fairly crisp finish.  Not a bad lager.
Wonderful session German beer...  A classic! ...............................
Light, pleasant nose. Very light yellow, OK head. Light malt taste, nice dry end. Thin, but balance. OK for a light lager - prima!
Gras-sy, hoppy aroma. Pale yellow body and a little head. Hoppy, short bitterness. Fizzy carbonation, short bitter aftertaste. Not very good.

This wasn't too bad, slightly industrial taste, sweetish start, slight bitter hops in the finish, very, slight resiny and spicyness noticed, downable stuff, but not too interesting. tasted very Bavarian. Not half bad, but their Weisbier and dunkelweiss are much better, stick with them.
Just a good german beer. better then spaten premium lager...................

Malty, bit soapy aroma. Sweetish, malty taste with peach. Nice and clean palate. A bit thin.
Tap. Grassy, hay-like aroma. Malty, grassy flavor with hints of butter. Thin to medium bodied. Hints of orange in hte aftertaste. Decent.

Pale gold clear under a medium-large lasting yellow white head. Very faint crisp sourish hoppy aroma. A touch too soft and thin in the palate for my taste. Medium mild hoppy bitter and asprin flavours.  There''s something clinically german about this beer that can''t stop me yawning - maybe it''s just that lagers are not my thing.
Suprisingly similar to the Oktoberfest. Overall a nice German lager - pleasantly sweet, nice mild hops and slight maltiness. Quite a short finish. Would be a nice session beer.
I'm not a fan of lagers in particular, but this one is alright.  I think I taste some wheat in there.  Not bad, not the best, but a very drinkable beer for a stout lover like me.

Update:  I was somewhat wrong.  When fresh, this has some very nice malt flavors and the graininess provides perfect relief.  A beautiful beer to look at, too.  I would prefer some more hops, like I get in Ayinger and Kraftbrau, or the rich maltiness of Hacker-Pschorr.  Now that I say that, however, I wonder how much difference there is between H-P and this one--has the merger of the breweries merged the flavor?

Old:  Much more hoppy and grainy than the typical Munchner Helles.  I find the malt character to be somewhat lacking here in comparison to Spaten and Hacker-Pschorr.  The focus is more on hops and graininess, making it rather like Rhineland pils (Warsteiner, Bitburger).  My least favorite helles of those produced by the big Munich breweries.
Hoppy floral aroma. Dry palate, pretty light in flavor and malt. Nice lingering hoppy finish. My complaint is that I really couldn't pick much between this and their pils.
Looks like a typical pilsener.  Nice hop aroma.  light-medium body and clean crisp taste make it a decent summertime brew.
Golden lager, nothing really stands out in it. A little maltiness, hints of hops. I like it because it's a light lager, but not watery.
Very nice hop bitterness amongst the omnipresent cereal…Everything is smooth, tasteful and balanced…
Crisp and slightly bitter.  Fairly smooth with a distinct maltiness that goes down well.
Clean lager, with a good hoppy finish.  You can tell why its been around so long.

tsk. i'm nowhere near bavaria and i didn't just do any strenuous outdoor activity which would render me a pushover for a featherweight, tho honest brew. plus, it's not exactly a brewery fresh  specimen: it pours a wan quasi-yellow, like  slightly jaundiced tap water. more head on a good loogie. you can sniff it till your dizzy, but there ain't much there but a pittance of golden malt and a  whiff of hops measured in parts per million. clean and refreshing, sure, attributes that it shares with water. it's smooth with a sweet suggestion of honeysuckle. i have the deepest respect for these munich helles, but for us junkies of the super-amped styles, this is liebfraumilch  when we need brandy.

This is my beer No 300 . Had on tap in Munich (where else ?!) . Refreshing , great quallity . Apperance was great , head lasted long , my glas got those rings after each sip etc ... Boy o BOY I ve had so many great pilseners in this week that I am not sure if I will go back to Canada and drink Lakeport anymore ... Plz help me ...

A bit too lightly colored, but ok head.
Very hoppy dry nose for a helles, but unfortunately this is not followed through to taste and body.

Great golden color, nice head.  Typical malty/buttery flavor profile.  Not too hoppy.  A simple beer, but lacking the true flavor of the style...probably due to the fact that it has sat in the bottle forever.

12 oz bottle pours a clear golden color with a small white head that doesn't last. Bready and flowery aroma, starts sweet and bready with a hint of grains, light bodied, somewhat of a thin and watery mouthfeel, finishes smooth and crisp, a bit above average IMHO.
Lemon flavored finish to the bland but well balanced lager..................
gold color, clean and crisp, nothing out of the ordinary, yet not yuky.  ...
really creamy head.  refreshing and crisp.  Nothing i'll remember...........
A nice enough lager, but it doesn't excite me at all. The best thing about this beer is its nice clean finish.

Yet another good bier from Paulaner.  Not a great lager fan.  However, this one was very well balanced.  Had a fair amount of carbonation.  Could have used some more hops.  But I guess if it ain't broke don't fix it.
One of the best lagers I've ever had. Nice and malty, clean, tasty beer. Puts American light lagers to shame.
A real solid lager effort from Paulaner!  Smooth, mild and very pleasant.  My second favorite after Yuengling's Traditional.
Nice light beer.  Head fades too quick.  More flavor and body than American beers.  Almost makes me forget about those dark beers.

This is a solid lager. Rich gold color, nice head. The malt is there, but well balanced by the hops. Paulaner could teach Spaten a thing or two about hops. A very serviceable alternative for when you can't find a Pilsner Urquell.
Crisp and drinkable.  I liked this better than the Spaten Lager I had the night before.
The best German Import I can get in my area.  Great beer, nice head.  Beautiful color.  Smooth and tasty.  Good hops.

I bought it because I'm trying to find more lagers that I like and Paulaner makes some pretty decent brews overall.  While this was a cut above most lagers you can get in the USA, it's not something I'm going to go out of my way for.  Definitely smooth and mellow, slightly sour smell which is reminiscient of Paulaner's hefe.  Decent hoppiness, minimal aftertaste.

I dont know what it was, I just didnt dig the flavor of this beer.  It looked nice, was very smooth, but the flavor just didnt do it for me.  The hops weren't bad at all, it just had a malty beginning that I didnt like.
I like the Hacker-Pschorr Munich better, but this is quite nice.............
Without a doubt my  lager of choice.........................................
mainstream lager, a bit thin and sweet. ....................................
The best german beer I've had with out question. almost as good as Yuengling Lager!

Bottle (BB Jun 2021). Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is light to medium yellow. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain/bread), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs), with a light note of soap. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Pretty bog standard Helles; not very interesting, but reasonably clean and quaffable. A bit soapy smelling (a la Ivory bars), but the malt and hops are nice enough (if kind of shy).
Very good on tap.  I haven't tried it in the bottle.........................

More texture than taste... this beer's heartiness makes it the standard-bearer for light lagers. Midly hoppy and good character to the final sip, although it has difficulty maintaining its carbonation.

All my favorite German commercial beers are from Bavaria. Usually known for excellent wheats, this lager proves the Bayerisch are no slouches in this style. Great presentation, masculine aroma, slightly sweet, crisp, thorough body, refreshing.
pretty disappointing. weak and a little sweet. why do they bother making this?
Pretty good, slightly sweet.  This is not my favorite style, but its pretty good nonetheless.
Excellent German lager, very smooth & very drinkable, great to sit out on the porch with one of these on a warmer day, very well balanced, a bit of a dry & spicy aftertaste, excellent lager
I'm not going to worship Paulaner beers like some do. It's OK stuff, we'll leave it at that.

Lags behind with Spaten as Munchen's worst beer.  Not as good as Hacker Pschor or Augustiner (or any of their country cousins, Ayinger, ForschingBraui or Andechs).  To light, not enough flavor, but I'd drink it forever if nothing else better was available.
A great german beer. Great flavor, full bodied. A classic...................

I've had this beer about a dozen times, and I am just thinking about rating it. This beer is okay.  Typical golden color with typical European lager flavor.  Grainy notes with sweetish, honey-like finish.
